When you USE YOUR HANDS A LOT, you become great friends with people like Hand Therapist Deborah Austin.  I have developed "Trigger Thumb" in both of my hands.  I am so talented, I have a "double" trigger in my right thumb!!! Very painful and stiff.   I was on the verge of doing surgery, which is a fine choice, but someone said you might want to consider hand therapy first.  So I did. She taught me several exercises to where I could bend the tips of my thumbs and prevent the other fingers from developing this condition. Very hard to pick up things without that flexibility.  Still a work in progress to get the swelling down, but grateful for the work she's done along with her partner Ivette, who helps her from time to time.  I must say she is pretty booked up, but it's an option you might want to consider.  Appreciate the recommendation by #MichaelGoldstein, always looking out.

"Reading The Enemy's Mail: Origins And Development Of U.S. Army Tactical Radio Intelligence In World War II European Theater of Operations."This traces the development of American radio intelligence at the operation and tactical levels from its beginnings in World War I through the end of World War II. It shows that signals intelligence is useful to the tactical and operational level commander. The study recommends the Army rethink signal intelligence support to the various echelons, primarily through changes to tables of organization and equipment. The thesis covers the initial appearance of radio intelligence units on the battlefields of France in the first world war, identifying specific instances where radio intelligence played a role in a command decision. It also looks at training and doctrine in the period between the two world wars. The thesis also covers the organization, doctrine, and training of radio intelligence units as they prepared for combat. It provides a glimpse into the intelligence support provided to the corps, army, and army group commanders during World War II through examination of actual intercept operations. Where possible, the study compares and contrasts German radio intelligence units and operations with their American counterparts.166p 1992U.S. Army Command and General Staff Collegehttps://lnkd.in/gPqjmmtPicture: Wireless in WW1: Marconi Motorcycle Set

One of the top questions I get from newbie freelancers: "How do I set my rates?"Unfortunately, there is no one-answer-fits-all for this question.Why?Because your rates are directly linked to your self-worth.When you're freelancing, you don't have a boss telling you "Here is your set monthly salary" i.e. this is how much you're worth.Instead, you're in complete control of how much you earn each month. Your salary isn't stagnant. It can go up or down. The ball is in your court to decide how much you're worth.That's scary AF.Sure, you can use ballpark figures from the South African Freelancers Association to figure out your rates or those nifty hourly-wage calculators.But if you don't believe your time and work is worthy of that amount (whether it's below, above, or in line with industry averages) you're going to have a hard time convincing anyone to pay you.And when you couple this with stats like:60% of women say they've never negotiated their salary (study linked below) Most of us are not prepared when we have to start telling potential CLIENTS what we want to be paid.Going into business is a major personal development exercise. All the beliefs that you have will come out of the woodwork to either help you or sabotage your efforts.Want to start working on your money story and beliefs? I highly recommend picking up a copy of You're a Bad Ass at Making Money by Jen Sincero. It's a great place to start and will shed light on what you're holding onto that's affecting how you show up around money.If you're looking for more support to get your freelance writing biz up and running, I'm hosting a 3-day workshop called Write to Wander with Alice Draper. It's designed to give you all the tools you need to start writing better stories and turning those pitching crickets into hell yeses.#freelancewriting

Credit Risk Associate Job Description:As a Credit Risk Associate in Real Estate Banking (REB), you are responsible for the underwriting and management of a portfolio of commercial real estate credits/relationships in a fast-paced, regulated environment. The Credit Risk Associate will also be involved in the loan closing and portfolio management process. Additionally, the Credit Risk Associate supports the preliminary underwriting of potential new deals by supporting the Approval to Pitch process. Candidates should have a good baseline knowledge of credit and lending with the expectation of developing these skills further while in this role. Knowledge of the commercial real estate industry and underwriting is a plus. Strong analytical and business writing skills are necessary. The role will have some customer contact so candidates should have solid communication skills.  Ideal candidates exhibits a strong interest in the sector, exceptional work ethic and attention to detail. Job Responsibilities include:·        Performing necessary credit analysis and due diligence on new loan opportunities including assisting in preparing Approval to Pitch Memos·        Working with Product Specialists and Client Associates to size and structure loans to mitigate risks·        Preparing Credit Approval Packages for approvals to Senior Credit Executives including final underwriting and risk rating recommendations.·        Working with loan administration and Product Specialists to facilitate loan closings·        Working with Portfolio Management to ensure credit worthiness of Borrowers/Guarantors/Sponsors and appropriate risk grades are assigned·        Ensuring compliance with established underwriting standards and guidelines, credit approval requirements, and other policies and procedures·        Communicating with clients on loan due diligence deliverables Qualifications:·                    Bachelor’s degree required·                    3+ years in a similar banking or credit role, with exceeds level performance·                    Ability to assess risks inherent in complex credit transactions, then mitigate and underwrite accordingly ·                    Accounting and finance knowledge, as well as knowledge of real estate fundamentals and concepts·                    Outstanding professional reputation and integrity·                    Strong leadership skills required·                    Strong analytical and business writing skills·                    Excellent problem solving, oral, and written communication skills·                    Superior knowledge of real estate market dynamics and economic drivers#hiring #realestate #commercialrealestate #jpmorganchase

Common business sense dictates that no two organizations will be the same in terms of organizational structure, culture, current capabilities etc. so any strategic initiative that may work for one might not work for the other. Yet, when we embark on strategic digital transformation initiatives, even before we look inside our processes and systems, we start asking what others are doing. While some generic best in class approaches can surely be adopted across companies and across industries, following the path of “one size fits all” for strategic initiatives, like developing an strategy around where and how to leverage AI capabilities in your business, is never a recommended path. In my perspective, every organization has a unique DNA. And hence any AI Strategy formulated needs to account for the unique challenges associated with THAT specific organization. #artificialintelligence #technology #technology #ai #businessandmanagement #strategy #machinelearning #digitaltransformation #analytics #innovation #business #digital #datascience #data #sapinsider

Great McKinsey & Company interview this week with former Overstock.com executive Seth Moore. Seth's practical experience with dynamic pricing and vision on best practices matches well what we have learned in our over 8 years of experience in implementing dynamic pricing at leading enterprise retailers and brands at Omnia Retail. Some examples:'Dynamic pricing can add value because it allows you to price the entire catalog with the same deliberate attention you give to important SKUs.''The answer to “How often should we change our prices?” is “as often as you have enough data to make a better decision than you did the last time you made a price change.'"Merchants develop their knowledge over time; retailers need to take that knowledge, test it, implement it, and automate it, which will free up merchants to focus on improving assortments and other merchandising levers.""Bringing merchants into the process early—so they can contribute to the development of algorithms and strategies—is critical. Involve them in the strategy formulation. Tell them, “We’re building an algorithm that will make pricing decisions in your category, using the same logic that you would use.”""By far the most important thing you can do, even if you don’t change anything about your pricing logic, is to fix your cost data. If you don’t know your item-level costs, you can’t make good item-level decisions.""Another lesson is that you should carefully consider consumer perception. Your price changes should never make the consumer wonder, “Am I being gouged?” Figure out what makes sense for your organization and for each product category. Is there a long buying cycle? Do shoppers tend to look at online customer reviews before they buy? Some categories—mattresses, for example—are heavily considered and researched, and there’s no urgency in the purchase process; customers will come back and view the same item a dozen times. But that’s not true of many other categories. So study web-analytics data to inform your dynamic-pricing approach."[regarding personalized pricing] "I recommend keeping base prices consistent so that consumers don’t feel discriminated against: “Why is that person getting a better price than me?” You should factor in promotions and shipping costs when setting your base prices. But you can offer some level of personalized pricing through discounts."--> If you want to receive a pdf of the full article, let me know via the comments or PM. #retail #dynamicpricing #omnichannel #ecommerce #pricing

The importance of having professional goals beyond work is hugely valuable, and something I completely underestimated until this year.I’d seen an Event Grads post on Facebook for industry newbies to enter the V Disrupt competition, to design some ideas for the micebook V Awards and compete for the chance to make the ideas come to life. I commented on the post to see if anyone wanted to team up, and the wonderful Ayame Kaikawa commented. We began video calling once a week, for 3 weeks, to develop our plans and create something to put forward to the judges.We submitted our proposal and later found out we’d made the final of the competition, meaning we now had to pitch our ideas verbally to the judges. It was an incredible experience, and although we did not win the competition, it was a huge learning experience, and I am so proud of putting myself out there. In the past year, I have grown so grateful for the network I have built, and look forward to finding and creating more opportunities to continue my professional development.If you want to mix things up and try something new before the end of the year, I recommend expanding your network and working on a project with someone new. It doesn’t need to be huge, but it’s so fulfilling ?

I've been working as a software engineer for almost five years but unfortunately never, ever had the experience of designing the deployment process and neither deployed anything into the production environment. That’s why my inner self really wanted to release something no matter whatever the app does and in the end, I did it! You know, better late than never!So, what does the Firecracker Vocab Practice do? Well, just imagine yourself as a lexicographer (or a group of lexicographers) enlisting unknown vocabulary into a personalized dictionary. Although, I believe other apps available on the Google Play Store are similar to this, TBH, I didn't consider delivering a unique app. An app is not just about writing bunches of codes. Therefore, I asked my near and dear ones and they helped a lot regardless of their busyness. Someone helped me choose the framework. Some other helped me to improve the UI and it is better than what I designed. If you look into the screen-shots on the Play Store, you may notice four test users with beautiful names and avatars. Not any of them had come from my brain. Even the name of the app and the logo are recommended and designed by my friends. There was a lot of vocabulary written in the Google Docs file. Unfortunately, I could not make it an automated process to insert those into the database because we didn’t follow any standards while adding those. So one of my friends transformed it into a TypeScript file. Definitely, that was a tedious and monotonous task but it has been done smoothly. I would like to thank my alpha test users, without them, I wouldn't be able to fix the last-minute bugs. As a developer, I know it is really difficult to release a bug-free app. So, my humble request is to report any kind of bug. Also, feel free to suggest anything. And it would be nice if you have a look at two of my repositories.BTW, it is not only an Android app, there is a web app too! But it is not functioning as the front-end makes the request to an HTTP server and is eventually blocked. Right now, I'm not thinking about a custom domain and SSL certificate. Therefore, only the sign-in page is being loaded. But you know, it is really an amazing thing that my own codes can run on various platforms!Priyanka Tarafdar Bristi, Nabila Tabassum Chowdhury, Parvez Mahbub, Nosheen Tasnim Chowdhury, Anirban Dutta, Anastasiia Shyrokovska, Felipe Calderano, Mannu Bardhan Paul, Khyrul Bashar; my heartfelt thanks to you! You people are awesome!Play Store link: https://lnkd.in/gNcTZAFSource codes:Backend: https://lnkd.in/ghNMuZmFrontend: https://lnkd.in/gAGnySS#TypeScript#NestJS#PostgreSQL#TypeORM#Jest#VueJS#IonicFramework#Capacitor#TravisCI#FirebaseAuthentication#FirebaseHosting#AmazonRDS#AmazonCodePipeline#AmazonElasticBeanstalk#AndroidPlayStore

I am not always an advocate of the most current #tech.  #Reactjs is currently powering nearly nine million websites worldwide.  WIth an estimated 200 million active websites, that means reactjs is running nearly 5% of the active internet at the time of this post (Y'all can fillet me if my math or stats are wrong).  Many of the projects we work on as a #freelancedeveloper do not require heavy libraries like reactjs.  Also, many of them use aging but mature technology stacks (hello php developers).  This being said, I have to admit I have been absolutely loving developing websites with #gatsbyjs and #graphql.  I feel that it is a front end framework that I will stick with for a while because it is both fast and has an awesome plugin ecosystem baked in.  I am really appreciating the modularity of react and the ability to create rich, dynamic "static" websites using the graphql queries.  if you are a #webdeveloper, I highly recommend giving gatsbyjs a try for smaller projects.  Heck, it can even do more complex projects like e-commerce if you want.  I am looking forward to sharing this website and its awesome performance gains soon,  #fullstackwebdeveloper #jamstack #javascriptdeveloper #scss #reactdeveloper #reactjsdevelopment #webdevelopers #nodejsdeveloper

POST-PANDEMIC TALENT ACQUISITION — HIRING ON A VIRTUAL THREAD Here we are almost halfway through 2021 and is it possible the “end” of the pandemic may be in sight? At least in the US and other Covid-19 vaccinated nations, there is daylight ahead and we are reopening. Does that mean we will be going back to traditional methods of talent acquisition and management? How will the hiring process look in the years ahead? We have learned that new virtual tools and processes are required for both recruiters and candidates in the remote and hybrid work environments in the future.Many HR professionals would likely enjoy going back to work onsite with in-person contact. However, that is not likely to be the case due to new methods of remote evaluation, verification, hiring and onboarding remote candidates. HR pros have learned that the pandemic forced a digital transformation in the way technology will be used to make hiring decisions going forward. In an article from Forbes early this year (4 Ways Hiring and Recruitment Will Change In 2021) a Sage report stated, “24% of businesses have started using AI for their talent acquisition needs, with 56% of managers planning to adopt automated technology in the next twelve months.” And, from a survey by the Society for Human Resource Management, it is estimated that “18% of companies use psychometric testing in the hiring process. This is expected to increase by 10-15% per year.” So, clearly, this is the direction this process is moving.NEW TOOLS AND SKILLS FOR THE MODERN HR MANAGER TO STAY CURRENT AND RELEVANTDigital hiring tools like pre-hire assessments and virtual interviews will be utilized for improved job matches. This leads to more efficiency and saves repetitious, routine tasks — allowing the HR pro to focus on high touch, subjective contact with candidates. And with virtual interviews, using video technology creates more fairness and consistency when interviewers use the same video and questions. According to TTISI — a leading assessment developer — it is recommended that assessment results comprise up to 40% of the hiring decision, with other evaluation methods to complete the final decision.HOW DO PRE-HIRE ASSESSMENTS HELP INCREASE CULTURES THAT SUPPORT DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION?Objective tools like psychometric assessments measure human characteristics based on social science and other research. Common areas for understanding job candidates include behavioral work styles, motivators, skills and competencies, emotional intelligence, and other critical factors. The process is “blind” and shows key areas like strengths, ideal work environments, and best match for team positions based on skill sets and compatibility, not personal preference and appearance.In the next article, let’s get specific with different types of assessments used for hiring line-staff to executives. We’ll also take a look at how these science-based tools can be used for onboarding and ongoing career development.

I recently completed the The Marketing Leadership Masterclass, delivered by Thomas Barta and Syl Saller CBE. The course is an immersive and interactive experience which taught me so much about leadership – upwards, sideways, in a team and in yourself. It was inspiring and engaging and has left me feeling excited about applying my learnings in the real world.I’d highly recommend the course to anyone in marketing who is looking to enhance their leadership skills whilst developing their professional network. Before I go, I’d like to share my three key takeaways from the course with you:1. Make sure you’re working in the Value Creation Zone - the point at which your company and customer needs meet and overlap. If you’ve not already defined the V-zone, it’s time to do it. 2. Take the quality staircase. Work with others (colleagues, teams and agencies) who push you to deliver the best.  3. Be brave. Bravery = purpose – fear. When the time is right, dare to put yourself out there. Thanks to Thomas, Syl and Oliver Bowie ACIM ACMI for such a great experience! #leadership #marketing #team

WHAT IS THE FUTURE OF ULTRAFAST GROCERY DELIVERY COMPANIES?First off, I want to compliment Sacra, for the excellent report that I’ve attached. LinkedIn members who read my posts know that I have stated multiple times that the grocery industry will undergo more changes between 2020 and 2030, than has taken place in the prior 100 years. Four things are significantly going to disrupt the grocery industry:1. Micro-fulfillment Centers like those offered by Berkshire Grey, AutoStore, Attabotics Inc., Urbx, Alert Innovation, Addverb, etc. 2. Micro-fulfillment as a Solution. This is the ability of grocery retailers (all retailers, actually) to outsource their micro-fulfillment needs to a third party like Davinci Micro Fulfillment or Uppership (https://www.uppership.com). 3. Mobile retail. Vans stocked with groceries. Instead of hailing an Uber, consumers can “hail a store.”  Robomart is the leader in this category. The other disruptor is the on-demand ultrafast grocery delivery companies that can deliver groceries in as little as 10-15 minutes. Gorillas, JOKR, Dija, Getir, and Delivery Hero, are considered the leaders in the industry. Gopuff and Instacart are attempting to duplicate the ultrafast players but with little success. I want to point out that I have consistently made the argument since 2013, that the main disruptor of the grocery industry will be the desire to increase the speed of deliveries to customers. In addition, deliveries will have to be made to wherever customers are; delivery to people vs. places. Yes, I am a champion for the micro-fulfillment industry but I’ve made it clear that micro-fulfillment isn’t enough. Grocery retailers must embrace automation, mobile retail, and rapid delivery solutions. I agree with the research outlined in the article that it will be a challenge for most of the rapid delivery companies to become profitable. I anticipate consolidation and failures to occur. I also agree with the research that companies like Uber can easily disrupt/replace the local grocery store. This is why I remain critical of the CEOs running grocery retailers who have failed miserably to change their business models by introducing mobile retail, micro-fulfillment or MaaS, and multi-tier services: physical stores, online, and rapid delivery. I laugh at the grocery retail trade shows and conferences that have completely failed to understand how severely grocery retailers will be disrupted by 2030. A review of speakers at the leading conferences are chocked full of such important topics as AI, advertising, and packaging. Ridiculous. The survival of the majority of grocery retailers is at stake and trade shows want to highlight packaging. By 2030, the grocery indistry will look completely different. Most aren’t ready.  #grocery #retail #onlineshopping #ecommerce #microfulfillment #lastmiledelivery https://lnkd.in/eb5TjyK

Yesterday's virtual lunch looked at improving digital ads with 1st party data ??. We also talked about the overall impact of digital marketing in light of continued data privacy restrictions. Thank you to Howard Diamond and Aaron Horowitz from Rise Interactive for co-hosting and sharing a number of insights. Below are a few highlights.?? Great discussion around the CDPs and starting with the use case to figure what you need. If the use case is CRM-driven that may take you in a different direction than if it's media driven. Lightweight CDP solutions are possible such as leaning into your ESP or tag manager.?? Retail media is working and is scalable. It's important to find the right retail partner and your mileage will vary depending on the product you're selling.?? The impact so far from data privacy restrictions that are creating less sophisticated targeting includes lower CPCs and CPMs. As far as metrics, mid-funnel is taking the biggest hit due to changes such as Facebook shortening its attribution window.?? There seems to be a consensus that retargeting outside of the Facebook and Google ecosystems have seen significant decreases in performance.#digitalmarketing #ecommerce #dataprivacy #cdps #roas cc Veronika Sonsev, Allan Dick, Emily Wander

I am excited to share that I joined Valley-Wide Financial Group on July 1st as Chief Operating Officer. Valley-Wide is a rapidly growing, privately held, financial services company based in Western Canada. Their subsidiaries include: Valley Wide Financial Corp., Valley Wide Insurance Services Inc., Prairie-Wide Financial Corp., Prairie-Wide Insurance Services Ltd., and Win/Succession. The Valley-Wide group of companies provide life and general insurance, investment solutions, group benefits and tax planning to individuals and businesses. I look forward to working with Scott Findlay, Darren Bowman, Michael Gau, and the rest of the team.Earlier this year, I joined The Catherine Wheel, a consulting and advisory firm working with and investing in small to midsize businesses in fintech, enterprise Saas and ecommerce as a Strategic Advisor, Insurance. I’ve been able to leverage my experience of building, launching and operating new services, products and business lines. I will continue in an advisory role working with Lina Ismail, Zaheer Merali, Philippe Garneau.My journey started a year ago when I found myself unemployed for the first time. What in some ways was the most challenging year of my life, was in a lot of ways the best year of my life. Before “the summer of Steve” as my partner Katherine Heggie first referred to it, I was fortunate to work at Empire Life for 11 years. I have great respect for Empire Life and the people who work there.I have a ton of energy and without work, I needed to stay busy. Office time was replaced with manual labour including building the best Zamboni on Dog Lake. Patent pending.I want to take this opportunity to thank everyone who helped me with my search. I've made 400+ new connections and had 200+ networking meetings. I've been blown away by the support from my partner, family, friends, former colleagues, and new connections.  I am grateful for your encouraging words, advice, introductions, and generosity with your time.  To each and every one of you, thank you.  Special thanks to Candace Thompson, my career transition coach at Right Management. Candace and her team provided me with the guidance and tools I needed to be successful in my search. Thank you Candace!In a Right Management webinar in January, the facilitator ended the session by saying ‘One thing I can tell you for sure, is that you will all find work.’ There were times I didn’t believe it. I am a positive person, yet there were times I feared that I wouldn't find work or I’d have to settle for something I’m not passionate about. To anyone out there looking for work: You will find work. You have a unique set of skills and experience and organizations need your talent. Keep making connections, looking for your dream job, and don’t settle. If I can help you in your job search in any way, please reach out.  I wish you all the best and look forward to reconnecting face to face as we create our new normal post COVID.Stephen

"Demonetisation coincided with the beginning of my career."We spoke to Prabhav, Business Development Associate at Instamojo about the growth & rise of digital solutions for businesses. ??"I have been involved with digitisation of SMEs & MSMEs ever since I started working. Be it POS machines, online payments, or eCommerce stores, I have had a fair share of experience with India's small business owners. There has been a gradual growth in these businesses opting for digital services. I feel the biggest hurdle for small businesses is that they do not know where to start. There is a gap between the options available to them and the awareness they have. They need a certain sense of handholding to get started; once they start, we have observed a lot of success stories. One of the most crucial aspects of my job is to understand these pain points and help in building solutions. I am glad that I am able to understand and help solve these problems through Instamojo online stores & online payments. If you look at emerging patterns, small towns and cities will actually form the base for our digital revolution. Once the adoption rates go up, they will be the ones driving upward growth. People are slowly learning to incorporate online tools into their business, and the best is yet to come."#mojofamily #businessdevelopement #bdes

We're HIRING! Senior Data Analyst, Dubai, UAE (Analytics & Marketing Technology) We represent one of the regions most respected Analytics and MarTech companies who are looking to hire a dynamic Senior Data Analyst to join their team right her in Dubai. The successful candidate will have a natural ability for seeing solutions in sprawling data sets and the business frame of mind to convert insights into media, content, and digital strategies.He or she will own digital marketing analytics (social, website, ecommerce, CRM) and forecasting, compiling data from multiple sources to create dynamic reports, dashboards, and ad hoc analyses, etc. Work alongside the teams to provide data backed insights into digital marketing, content strategies, audience segmentations, and performance marketing to drive A/B testing, customer acquisition, personalization strategies, etc.Proactively analyze online user behavior, CRM data, social media data, eCommerce conversions, customer journeys, funnel analysis and multi-channel attribution in order to develop strong hypotheses and uncover business insights and opportunities across marketing channels, tactics, and audience segments. Partner with development and tech teams to ensure we are capturing the most meaningful data accurately for reporting and analysis purposes (eg: QA’ing tags and campaign setup). Manage existing data tools (Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Sprinklr, etc) – creation of self-service dashboards, liaison with tech support, and even finding new ways of unlocking tool’s potential.In Summary:- 5+ years of experience in digital media, performance marketing, or campaign management (paid acquisition, CRM, multitouch attribution, etc.) Advanced experience with Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target, Google Analytics, Adwords, Google Tag Manager, Ecommerce tools (like Shopify), and Social analytics tools (like Sprinklr and Social Bakers) is a must. Broad understanding of website optimization tools (Optimizely, AB Tasty, etc). Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Google Data Studio, etc.) Strong Excel skills (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP, etc.) with experience manipulating, analyzing, and visualizing data Experience with SQL/ R/ Python/ Matlab/Stata is a plus. Experience working with large data sets, deep-dive data analysis including experience extracting and manipulating data using queries (SQL) and Regression analysis to develop predictive modelsIf this exciting position sounds of interest and you have the matching skills to deliver on such a role, please contact Cess Batula on: cess@emiratalent.com #jobsintech #analyticsjobs EmiraTalent? #martech

Aluminum picking carts 2.0So our first try at providing custom aluminum carts turned out OK, but the upgraded cart turned out amazing. Super light weight, easy to maneuver / handle, and best of all looks stunning! Working with our preferred local fabricator we went back to the R&D department to discuss useful upgrades. After observing the team using the aluminum carts and paying attention to their habits I realized that a couple properly placed handles would help with further ease of handling the carts. We also added a bit of extra support to the bottom as a safety feature in case someone were to try and use the back bottom shelf as a step (this is not meant to be a step). We adjusted the top shelf height to sit lower to better accommodate the actual team that will be regularly using the carts every shift. And last of all we added a custom powder coat paint in our clients logo color to give the cart a nice clean looking finish. With the growing demand for e-commerce orders to get out quicker than ever to consumers I know these carts are going to be a hit with all of our fulfillment type clients. Light weight and super efficient for picking. Who is next? These carts would look amazing in your company colors, not to mention the efficiency it will help to add to your teams picking! Canadian Rack Technologies Inc. can work with you to come up with a custom cart solution for your picking needs too, we are only a call away. #picking #carts #aluminum #2.0 #pickingcarts #orderpicking #orders #fulfillment #3pl #warehousing #ecommerce #cart #materialhandling #MHE #warehouses #custom #paint #equipment #safety #design #commerce #quality

Senior Data Analyst, Dubai, UAE (Analytics & Marketing Technology) We represent one of the regions most respected Analytics and MarTech companies who are looking to hire a dynamic Senior Data Analyst to join their team right her in Dubai. The successful candidate will have a natural ability for seeing solutions in sprawling data sets and the business frame of mind to convert insights into media, content, and digital strategies.He or she will own digital marketing analytics (social, website, ecommerce, CRM) and forecasting, compiling data from multiple sources to create dynamic reports, dashboards, and ad hoc analyses, etc. Work alongside the teams to provide data backed insights into digital marketing, content strategies, audience segmentations, and performance marketing to drive A/B testing, customer acquisition, personalization strategies, etc.Proactively analyze online user behavior, CRM data, social media data, eCommerce conversions, customer journeys, funnel analysis and multi-channel attribution in order to develop strong hypotheses and uncover business insights and opportunities across marketing channels, tactics, and audience segments. Experience working with large data sets, deep-dive data analysis including experience extracting and manipulating data using queries (SQL) and Regression analysis to develop predictive modelsIf this exciting position sounds of interest and you have the matching skills to deliver on such a role, please contact our Director & Head of Technology, Tom Fitzpatrick on: tom@emiratalent.com #jobsintech #analyticsjobs EmiraTalent? #martech

As schools break up across the UK and Europe for the summer, brands are already looking to the horizon at the rapidly approaching 2021 Q4 Peak.According to a Retail Week Deep dive: 'Tackling the Fulfilment Nightmare before Christmas', in addition to the usual challenges of retail's peak period, 2021 is facing into a lack of resources in haulage, food processing and production lines, and packing. A warning today from Marks and Spencer CEO Steve Rowe, that store opening hours may need to be reduced due to staff shortages as a result of COVID isolation (the 'pingdemic'), growth in online customer purchasing could continue exponentially.    In 2020, online penetration surged to 31.9% from 20.8% in 2019’s golden quarter, while research from ecommerce specialist ChannelAdvisor has found that over half (55%) of consumers intend to shop online more post-Covid than they did before.  Retailers understandably are working hard to find solutions and partners that will ensure they maximise the significant opportunities in this year's peak period while minimising disruption and disappointment for customers.Focused exclusively on the retail, e-retail and ecommerce sector, here at Ascensos, managing peak period customer interactions for national and international brands comes as standard. Whether it's the Spring peak for DIY and Homeware, the Summer peak for fashion or the Q4 peaks for Black Friday, Christmas and New Year clearance sales, we combine data, technology and platforms with the best people, training and location strategies to support our clients and their customers - whatever their supply chain and logistical challenges may be.#ecommerce #retailing #innovation #economy #onlineshopping #shoppingandtheretailindustry #customerservice #rpa #digital #automation #21stCenturyRetail

I've been working as a software engineer for almost five years but unfortunately never, ever had the experience of designing the deployment process and neither deployed anything into the production environment. That’s why my inner self really wanted to release something no matter whatever the app does and in the end, I did it! You know, better late than never!So, what does the Firecracker Vocab Practice do? Well, just imagine yourself as a lexicographer (or a group of lexicographers) enlisting unknown vocabulary into a personalized dictionary. Although, I believe other apps available on the Google Play Store are similar to this, TBH, I didn't consider delivering a unique app. An app is not just about writing bunches of codes. Therefore, I asked my near and dear ones and they helped a lot regardless of their busyness. Someone helped me choose the framework. Some other helped me to improve the UI and it is better than what I designed. If you look into the screen-shots on the Play Store, you may notice four test users with beautiful names and avatars. Not any of them had come from my brain. Even the name of the app and the logo are recommended and designed by my friends. There was a lot of vocabulary written in the Google Docs file. Unfortunately, I could not make it an automated process to insert those into the database because we didn’t follow any standards while adding those. So one of my friends transformed it into a TypeScript file. Definitely, that was a tedious and monotonous task but it has been done smoothly. I would like to thank my alpha test users, without them, I wouldn't be able to fix the last-minute bugs. As a developer, I know it is really difficult to release a bug-free app. So, my humble request is to report any kind of bug. Also, feel free to suggest anything. And it would be nice if you have a look at two of my repositories.BTW, it is not only an Android app, there is a web app too! But it is not functioning as the front-end makes the request to an HTTP server and is eventually blocked. Right now, I'm not thinking about a custom domain and SSL certificate. Therefore, only the sign-in page is being loaded. But you know, it is really an amazing thing that my own codes can run on various platforms!Priyanka Tarafdar Bristi, Nabila Tabassum Chowdhury, Parvez Mahbub, Nosheen Tasnim Chowdhury, Anirban Dutta, Anastasiia Shyrokovska, Felipe Calderano, Mannu Bardhan Paul, Khyrul Bashar; my heartfelt thanks to you! You people are awesome!Play Store link: https://lnkd.in/gNcTZAFSource codes:Backend: https://lnkd.in/ghNMuZmFrontend: https://lnkd.in/gAGnySS#TypeScript#NestJS#PostgreSQL#TypeORM#Jest#VueJS#IonicFramework#Capacitor#TravisCI#FirebaseAuthentication#FirebaseHosting#AmazonRDS#AmazonCodePipeline#AmazonElasticBeanstalk#AndroidPlayStore

Yesterday I shared the SBOM Minimum Elements publication from US Department of Commerce, NTIAContinuing on with the theme of Software Supply Chain Security, per the Cyber EO, National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) along with the National Security Agency were tasked with publishing guidelines recommending minimum standards for vendors' testing of their software code. Those guidelines are now published in the attached "Guidelines on Minimum Standards for Developer Verification of Software" The document describes eleven recommendations for software verification techniques. These include:- Threat modeling to look for design-level security issues- Automated testing for consistency and to minimize human effort- Static code scanning to look for top bugs- Heuristic tools to look for possible hardcoded secrets- Use of build-in checks and protections- "Black box" test cases- Code-based structural test cases- Historical test cases- Fuzzing- Web app scanners, if applicable- Address included code (libraries, packages, services) "To ensure that software is sufficiently safe and secure, software must be designed, built, delivered, and maintained well. Frequent and thorough verification by developers as early as possible in the software development life cycle (SDLC) is one critical element of software security assurance."#ciso #infosec #security #cyber #cybersecurity #publicsector #software #sdlc #devsecops #nationalsecurity #technology #softwaredevelopment #incidentresponse

Stanford University PRISM Postdoctoral Training OpportunitiesWe are thrilled to announce that the application is now open for our 8th PRISM Cohort! Stanford PRISM is a recruitment opportunity for late-stage graduate students from diverse backgrounds to explore postdoctoral training at Stanford.What is Stanford PRISM? PRISM (Postdoctoral Recruitment Initiative in Science and Medicine) is an opportunity for select late-stage graduate students from broadly diverse backgrounds to explore postdoctoral training at Stanford. PRISM gives you direct support with support and initiatives such as: interviewing with potential mentors, getting the inside scoop on postdoctoral training at Stanford from current postdocs, and even accessing professional development to score the best postdoc match for them! The purpose of this program is to encourage those who might not otherwise consider a postdoctoral position at Stanford to get a first-hand look at whether Stanford might be a good fit for them... Our goal is to match excellent trainees to excellent mentors at Stanford!This opportunity is open to all. We especially encourage those from backgrounds underrepresented in academia to apply, including communities such as but not limited to: African Americans, Latinos, Native Americans, Pacific Islanders, Filipinos, those with disabilities, those from FLI backgrounds, and those underrepresented on the basis of their gender identity, gender expression, and/or sexual orientation. Applications consist of an application form, a CV, a research statement, a recommendation from your graduate advisor, and the names of up to 6 potential mentors at Stanford.For more information on our program and/or to apply, please visit our webpage at:https://lnkd.in/edaQzSR Fall 2021 Dates for PRISM Cohort 8: October 13th-16th, 2021(Deadline to Apply for Cohort 8 = July 26th, 2021!)We hope to bring PRISM Cohort 8 to campus (in-person) for a 3-5-night stay on Stanford University's campus. The goal is for prospective postdocs to use that time to explore the training environment, meet with faculty, and get a feel for the community here at Stanford. Please Note: Travel will be dependent upon travel policies at that time... (If we are unable to host candidates in-person, a full complement of recruitment events will be offered virtually.) #research #medicine #science #students #education #highereducation #internship #training #opportunity #professionaldevelopment #career

This is an oldie but goodie. Synthetic data, fabricated data that looks real, is a game changer in app development. It lets teams sidestep issues related to working with sensitive data, and supports volume testing efforts. The challenge has been generating synthetic data, which is the problem the tools and research discussed in this article aim to address. I highly recommend new and aspiring data architects orient themselves on synthetic data - what it is, when to use it, and how to generate it. #data #development

Dane Morrison, VM’s Information Technology Audit Lead, is today’s personality and high achiever for #TeamMemberHighlight. Take a look at how he stays motivated for excellence. “I once heard someone say, “You drive a lot faster if you know you have good brakes.” And I think this perfectly captures the role of internal audit. It is about providing the VM Group with the assurance and confidence that our controls, governance, processes, and systems are effective and are up to the task of facilitating us in meeting our objectives. So, we conduct reviews to verify that things are working as they should and where we identify gaps or weaknesses, we make recommendations on how those gaps can be closed and those areas strengthened. One of the things that excites me the most is witnessing first-hand the transformation that has taken place and that continues to take place at VM. The development and expansion of our online banking apps and platforms and the overall digital transformation journey are something I am really excited about. I am driven for excellence in all I do, and I think my upbringing has had the most influence in that regard. My parents always urged my siblings and I to do everything we did, no matter how insignificant, with excellence. I can remember my mother drilling into me growing up that if I did my household chores sloppily then that kind of approach would ‘spill’ over into other areas. And the older I get, the more I realise how true that is, you can’t just try to create islands of excellence, areas you are willing to work hard at as opposed to other areas. You must try and develop a culture of doing everything to the best of your ability. My encouragement to other Team Members is to always try to surpass yesterday’s successes. Be teachable, be trainable, learn from your mistakes, your successes, and your team members. Everyone has a lesson to teach; there is so much I have learned from observing and receiving feedback from my colleagues.”

Hi,My name is PRAMODH REDDY. I just received details on a great job that I believe you would be a great fit for. Please take a look below and share your interest. If not interested, I would also appreciate if you can recommend me someone looking for a similar roleAPI DEVELOPER WITH FRONT END EXPERIENCE6+ MONTH CONTRACTPHONE THEN VIDEOJOB DESCRIPTION:CLIENT HAS AN IMMEDIATE NEED FOR API DEVELOPERS WITH FRONT END EXPERIENCE THAT HAVE SKILLS AROUND THE FOLLOWINGSpringbootJPAJava (version 8)MicroservicesRabbit MQAngular Front EndJ Query Front EndNICE TO HAVE:PCFMulesoftLOCATION Richardson/ChicagoMUST HAVES--SPRING BOOT is an open source Java-based framework USEDto create a micro Service. It is developed by Pivotal Team and is USED to build stand-alone and production ready SPRIN Gapplications.-JPA is an abreviation that stands for Java Persistence API. It's a specification which is part of Java EE and defines an API for object-relational mappings and for managing persistent objects. You can use this API in Java SE and Java EE environments-JAVA 8is a revolutionary release of the world's #1 development platform. ...JAVA 8includes features for productivity, ease of use, improved polyglot programming, security and improved performance. Welcome to the latest iteration of the largest, open, standards-based, community-driven platform.-MICROSERVICES are a form of service-oriented architecture style (one of the most important skills for JAVA developers) wherein applications are built as a collection of different smaller services rather than one whole app.-JQUERY is a lightweight, "write less, do more", JavaScript library. The purpose of JQUERY is to make it much easier to USE Java Script on your website. JQUERY takes a lot of common tasks that require many lines of JavaScript code to accomplish, and wraps them into methods that you can call with a single line of code.-RABBITMQ is a message-queueing software also known as a message broker or queue manager. Simply said; it is software where queues are defined, to which applications connect in order to transfer a message or messages. A message can include any kind of information. ...-ANGULAR is a platform and framework for building single-page client applications using HTML and Type Script .ANGULAR is written in TypeScript. It implements core and optional functionality as a set of TypeScript libraries that you import into your applications.NICE TO HAVES:-The PCF JAVA-client project is a JAVA language binding for interacting with a Pivotal Cloud Foundry instance. #Urgenthiring for the position of :-Senior Solutions Architect, Strategy – Secret Clearance
Arlington, VA
Sign-On Bonus + Relocation Available

The Challenge:
At a certain point, experience based system design can start to look like clairvoyance. When you’ve developed so many systems that you can not only orchestrate the best solution for any technology based challenge, but you can also anticipate and preempt future issues, you’re a solutions architect. You’ve evolved your skills into strategy through a long path of software development accomplishments and the curiosity to understand how all of the pieces of an IT ecosystem fit together. Are you ready to use your combination of knowledge, skill, and experience to tackle the toughest challenges in a DoD enterprise transformation?

As a solutions architect on our team, you'll translate your customer’s IT needs and future goals into a plan by crafting solution architectures, architecture products, and strategic recommendations to the client. Through your leadership, we’ll help transform the way DoD uses technology including cloud migration, integrating advanced technology, and modernizing legacy systems. And, what do you do next in a career where you’ve reached this level? You mentor the next set of developers to help them grow into tomorrow’s solutions architects. Join us and build the future of technology in DoD for the better.Empower change with us.

You Have:
6+ years of experience as a web or cloud architect designing client solutions
4+ years of experience with designing architectures using APIs, basic web/cloud security, and data repositories
Experience with preparing and briefing details of technical analysis
Active Secret clearance
BA or BS degree

Nice If You Have:
Experience with mobile solutions or apps for a government client
Experience with documenting analysis in Microsoft Office products, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Knowledge of general network technologies and principles
Knowledge of the Department of the Navy's organization structure and ranks
Knowledge of DoD Architecture Framework (DoDAF)
Possession of excellent oral and written communication skills
Possession of excellent client-facing and consulting skills
MA or MS degree

Clearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Secret clearance is required.

This month I received my TechLabs Web Development certification specializing in backend together with Søren Kristian Simonsen, Jesper Jensen and Mark Elimann. We did this as part of a new coordination between TechLabs and our university towards a technical project. The past few months were both extremely challenging but also really fulfilling. I learned by doing- creating a coffee app, and used theory to navigate the project. While writing about Design Thinking simultaneously trying to build an infrastructure with Node.js seemed impossible, we got through it. It was fun and I look forward to further developing our product. I learned a new language, what building a product entails, what working on a team with different specialties is like, amongst many other things.TechLabs Copenhagen did a wonderful job. We also had interesting talks from different companies and individuals in the tech industry. I highly recommend them and I’m so happy to have done this! #webdevelopment #nodejs #designthinking # #team #project #innovation #tech #engineering #javascript

Senior Solutions Architect, Strategy – Secret ClearanceArlington, VASign-On Bonus + Relocation AvailableThe Challenge:At a certain point, experience-based system design can start to look like clairvoyance. When you’ve developed so many systems that you can not only orchestrate the best solution for any technology-based challenge, but you can also anticipate and preempt future issues, you’re a solutions architect. You’ve evolved your skills into strategy through a long path of software development accomplishments and the curiosity to understand how all of the pieces of an IT ecosystem fit together. Are you ready to use your combination of knowledge, skill, and experience to tackle the toughest challenges in a DoD enterprise transformation?As a solutions architect on our team, you'll translate your customer’s IT needs and future goals into a plan by crafting solution architectures, architecture products, and strategic recommendations for the client. Through your leadership, we’ll help transform the way DoD uses technology including cloud migration, integrating advanced technology, and modernizing legacy systems. And, what do you do next in a career where you’ve reached this level? You mentor the next set of developers to help them grow into tomorrow’s solutions architects. Join us and build the future of technology in DoD for the better. Empower change with us.You Have:6+ years of experience as a web or cloud architect designing client solutions4+ years of experience with designing architectures using APIs, basic web/cloud security, and data repositoriesExperience with preparing and briefing details of technical analysisActive Secret clearanceBA or BS degreeNice If You Have:Experience with mobile solutions or apps for a government clientExperience with documenting analysis in Microsoft Office products, including Word, Excel, and PowerPointKnowledge of general network technologies and principlesKnowledge of the Department of the Navy's organization structure and ranksKnowledge of DoD Architecture Framework (DoDAF)Possession of excellent oral and written communication skillsPossession of excellent client-facing and consulting skillsMA or MS degreeClearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Secret clearance is required.Build Your Career:A challenging and dynamic work environment isn’t all we have to offer. * Kamiel Keeris*Meet Kamiel, Thames Distribution’s Business Development specialist for Benelux & EU. - How long have you been at Thames?I joined in Oct ‘20, in the middle of our busy season (and Corona times). Before that I had multiple roles in retail spanning 18 yrs: as a vendor, owning my own Apple blog/webshop and starting a CE distribution business. An interesting journey so far!  - Describe yourself outside of work.I’m pretty much the same person inside and outside of work: easy going and approachable. I’m always in for some ‘wining and dining’… in The Netherlands we call that a ‘Bourgondiër'.- What is guaranteed to put a smile on your face? Unboxing a new piece of tech usually brings a smile to my face because it means new business to be done!- Something you learned recently.I never thought doing a martial art would be my thing, but I really enjoyed my first boxing lessons in the local park.- Three traits that define you.LoyalCreativeDevoted Who do you admire and why? My dad because he’s the most talented and creative person I’ve met so far, from drawing to developing innovative engineering solutions to complex problems.- Favourite bit of tech?Right now it's the GeoSmartPro AirGo Smart Fan, because it’s so convenient. It’s quiet, app-controlled and helps me stay cool during those hot summer nights. - What would your superpower be?Had you asked me this 30 years ago it would probably have been ‘invisibility’ but now I’m a bit older and more environmentally aware I’d rather be more like Captain Planet!- Describe one of your interests.A long term interest of mine is to see how we develop as a species, how we tackle complex world problems and how we go about taking better care of our planet and its inhabitants. Your must-see TV recommendation: The new Clarkson show about his farm. Absolutely hilarious, but also interesting to see how he always just goes for it - nothing is impossible. Scary to see he actually becomes quite a decent farmer.  - One thing you're looking forward to.Same as many, I reckon, that life gets back to normal. From a business perspective: face-to-face meetings and IFA, CES and other trade shows to meet old and new industry friends.www.thamesdistribution.com

Best places to hire freelance Bubble Developers?The 'No-Code' revolution has taken the tech world by storm. Bubble is one of the top no-code platforms which allow you to create powerful web apps without knowledge of coding. Here's a list of places where you can hire Bubble Freelancers and Developers:?1) Niche Freelancing Websites:In addition to the mainstream freelancing platforms like Upwork, Fiverr, Freelancer.com and Toptal. There are several niche websites, which specifically focus on technology talent, developers and experts in no-code development tools. Some of the top places to hire bubble developers and other no-code experts are Nucode (Nucode.co), Codemap.io (Codemap.io) and Makerpad (experts.makerpad.co). ?2) Bubble Dev Agencies:?A great way to hire top quality talent which are Bubble experts are looking at the Development Agencies listed on the Bubble website . There are over 200 agencies now listed, ranging all the way from solopreneurs and single member agencies to larger dev shops with multiple employees and expertise in various aspects of application design as well as development. Several of these agencies have been developing bubble applications for many years and offer additional resources (Courses, 1-1 Sessions, Newsletters) in addition to development services. Some of the top agencies in this field are Million Labs, MVP.dev, Airdev and Zeroqode amongst many more.?3) Bubble Forum:Another great way to hire freelance bubble experts is by posting on the Bubble forum. There is a specific category within the forum called 'Jobs/Freelance' - where you can post your job requirements and invite proposals and messages from freelancers and agencies across the world. The posts on this category on the forum typically have between 3-5 responses in addition to the direct messages you can expect to get from available freelancers.4) Social Media Platforms:Social media platforms (particularly LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook and Reddit) can also be a very effective way to hire Bubble or no-code developers, particularly if the requirements that you have are unique. E.g. if you are looking for a developer with expertise in a particular sector, or are looking to hire someone on a non-standard payment terms (e.g. offering cash + equity in return for the development work). There are a couple of ways you can go about this:4a) By creating a post and asking your network for recommendations. Make sure to add additional keywords and hashtags to ensure that the post has the maximum visibility possible. 4b) Using Advanced search functionality to search for profiles with the relevant skills and titles and sending them direct messages.

????? ? ???? ????? ? ! (??) ??????? ??????:https://lnkd.in/dxbPSyA#3 #CodeAndCocktailsStart CodingI started coding the project by creating all the parts described in UML within the Client. I thought it would be convenient for me to be able to check it through the browser.Mistake!!! It led to A LOT of headaches later on. Now I know better and highly recommend coding Backend in Server and checking it through the logger (after all, you will do the same in the browser). And using #postman, which is a fantastic app for sending and receiving requests from the server.Very quickly, I encountered my first problem with the way I looked at the project.Lemons and Bottles do not behave the same. 100 ml is less than 3 shots. On the other hand, 100 lemons is a lot, and I'll never have so many at home.So I recalculated my thinking and created four types of elements that inherit from one abstract object ( #oop ). Bottle, Fruits and Vegetables, Boolean variable (available or out of stock. No quantity) and Generic variable.I also created a DbMuck that simulated my DB and would allow me to check the functions supposed to communicate with it.At this point, I turned DbMuck and the Managers into singletons. There's no need to have more than one instance of these in my application.for ! (not) programmers * I started building the thinking part in the area that displays information to users because I thought it would be convenient to see the information. It was a mistake and caused a mess later!* Planning Inventory only on bottles was incorrect.Lemons and Bottles do not behave the same. 100 ml is less than 3 shots. On the other hand, 100 lemons is a lot, and I'll never have so many at home.* I created a data-saving demo to deal with data saving in my app. Though it's not real, it was real enough for my software.#SmartBarProject #myblog #developer #webdevelopment

Finding the right app development team can be a daunting task. There are many app developers on the market, but this doesn’t necessarily mean that you can just pick any among them to work on your project. The right team will need to understand your needs and your business model to build the right product.Primarily, the critical question you will have to ask is whether you want to hire an in-house team or pick freelancers to work on your project.In-house teams can work on a product from inside your company, but this option can get pricey and may not be right for you. Hiring a team from a software house, however, gives you more flexibility to quickly source developers with the right skills.It is worth noting that in-house developers will cost more in the long run. They know how professional their services are, and they will command a hefty price. While no one can blame them, you will also need to find ways to save money — especially if resources are limited. This is why many choose to outsource instead.Generally, you can answer the question of how to find the best mobile app development company by considering your business and your needs. For instance, if you work at an established firm and would like to get things working much quicker, consider hiring a professional outsourced team. Check our list of 10 Best Countries to Outsource Software Development to help you take the first step to find the right company: https://bit.ly/3wF6kQJStartups can also benefit from the flexibility of working with a software house. Keep your costs in check with a team that adapts to your needs. You can expand a team of specialists quickly to fit your project scope.Reviews sites such as Clutch.com are a great place to start your search. You can easily shortlist companies that fit your needs. Of course, it also never hurts to look through your connections and see if there are recommendations.Read more in our blog: https://bit.ly/36EvuED#softwaredevelopment #appdevelopment #appdevelopmentcompany #hiring

I PASSED my final exam for the professional diploma in UX Design ?? 10 months of late nights and weekends… totally worth it, and I highly recommend the course if you are looking to transition into UX. I have always loved wireframing and prototyping, so I chose this course to explore research techniques, fill any gaps and essentially build a design process from the beginning of research until handing-off to developers. Creating a flight app was a really fun project as there are many facets to consider… kept me on my toes. ?? A huge thank you to my girlfriend and family… studying, whilst working during this crazy pandemic has been a real test. A huge thank you to Ken Loh, Richard Baxter, Bhups Patel, James Killington  for giving me their time and experience through video chats and time zone differences with no trouble at all… absolute legends, and also the rest of the wonderful teams at ?. And lastly, the team at the UX Design Institute for supporting the journey Eoghan, Rebecca, Ultan and Colman Walsh for offering this great course and content.Next steps, finish my portfolio and see what the world has to offer. ?? #userexperiencedesign #interactiondesign #userresearch #experiencedesign #ux #uxdesign

It’s so awesome when men advocate for females in tech. Richard Miller in the UK, was one of the first guys that gave a talk at the Theodo / React Native meet-up in London, and one of the leading experts in React Native at the time, having worked previously for Fat Llama. Richard was also instrumental in August 2019 in helping us move our Travltalk tech stack in house, and sort out our in-app purchase, ejection from Expo kit to being a stand alone React Native app, and removing the concerns we had around Branch.io / Expo tracking. I’ll be eternally grateful to him and wish all developers could be like him. I highly recommend him if you are looking for a top dev. https://lnkd.in/eFR4BZcI have to say, what I learned being a full time developer since, and writing code myself, as well as managing all devs ops, deployments and development choices was a steep learning curve, but something I will never ?regret. Also couldn’t be prouder of selecting React Native when it was still in its infancy and sticking with GraphQL / Apollo and Nextjs for SSR, and moving back to AWS from Vercel for our backend. It’s clear in 2021 these languages and frameworks are the stack of the future.

Amazon, Google, and other giant websites have one thing in common - they are easy to interact with and provide a terrific customer experience. UI/UX are major components of your website or application's effectiveness. Let's have a look at the points below to understand how UI/UX is important for your business: 1. Boosts website & app traffic - An efficient UI/UX design is user-friendly, visually appealing, and contains a flow of useful information. Such kind of interface keeps the audience glued to any site or app. Users are more likely to interact with your website when it has a realistic feel to it and is easy to use. Hence, seamless interaction boosts natural traffic to your site and app. 2. Ensures cost savings - Investing in a good UI/UX design alleviates the number of recurring issues in your website or app. Good UI/UX designs reduce the need for frequent updates and save the time and money that you would have, otherwise, spent on repair and development.3. Increases ROI - An attractive design ensures easy navigation and keeps your customers engaged for a longer time. Highly satisfied customers will recommend your website or app to others and this will further boost engagement. More engagements lead to more conversions, thereby increasing your ROI.Have you optimized the user experience for your business yet? You always need to be extra careful when it comes to fast and easy ways to earn in crypto world.Thousands of users were scammed into buying fake cryptocurrency apps through the Google Play Store. A California-based security firm reports that these apps are advertised as a way of earning money via mining crypto, but in reality they don’t perform any function. Instead, all of these paid apps include costly upgrades and subscription models to allegedly improve the performance of mining.The security firm recommends knowing the developers behind these apps before buying them, installing them only from the official source, and reading user reviews of the app to look for any anomalies.#security #cryptocurrency #cybersecurity

Q&A session??We're glad to share with you so expected post about the career of our Front-End Developer — Ivan????Could you please tell us about your career start and why did you choose the front-end development?? Back in 2014, when I was still a student at Kyiv Polytechnic Institute, I learned CSS/Html and JS. My friend once told me that the company he worked for was looking for a guy to develop websites. I applied for the position and got it. That's how I first got into the IT industry.??Please tell us more about joining ETER Solutions and what interested you the most in the company?? I found the project interesting: I like to create tools to help businesses. When I joined ETER, the project was just starting, so we had no legacy and had an opportunity to decide which technologies to use. I liked the interview too: I found the TL very experienced and interested in the project. I knew that the product would be used right after the release, and we'd get feedback from our users. Now we already have people using our software: managers who use our web app, and drivers who use our mobile app. It's inspiring to see people using a product we've created.Now I work as a FE developer, so I'm responsible for our Web part??. I wouldn't say that my role has changed a lot over time, but seeing our project developing, I now know every detail of it, so I can plan and estimate the next features better. I also help our new colleagues to get on board.??Please describe your main duties on the project at ETER Solutions.? I'm a Front-End developer, but there was a period when I switched to mobile development. And this is what is really cool about ETER: company allows us to grow by trying new different technologies. Right now, I'm interested in React Native, and I have an opportunity to try it out. Now we're working as a cozy small team, but obviously, we'll grow, and each of us will grow in our career paths.??What difficulties did you face combining the positions of both roles: ReactJS and RN developer?? You know what they say about React: "learn once, write anywhere". And this is true, you can start mobile development right away knowing React. You will ‘google’ a lot, and it's fine. Mobile development is really interesting, and I suggest everyone try it at least once. Codewise it’s pretty similar to FE development, but in ?? development you'd use different tools, such as RN debugger, Android and IOS emulators, you'd run your application on a real device. I mean, it’s a whole different experience.??What would you recommend for junior specialists, who just started their careers?? I'd suggest to find a mentor to watch him work and ask questions. ?ode review is helpful too: ask your peers to leave as many comments as they can, and start reviewing the code of your colleagues, it'll help you to gain experience faster.At ETER Solutions we believe that team work make a great work, especially with so dedicated employees.#eter #eterteam #reactjs #reactnative

Executive Order (EO) 14028, Improving the Nation’s Cybersecurity, 12 May 2021, directs the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) to recommend minimum 
standards for software testing within 60 days. This document describes eleven recommen-
dations for software verification techniques as well as providing supplemental information 
about the techniques and references for further information. It recommends the following 
techniques: 
• Threat modeling to look for design-level security issues 
• Automated testing for consistency and to minimize human effort 
• Static code scanning to look for top bugs 
• Heuristic tools to look for possible hardcoded secrets 
• Use of built-in checks and protections 
• “Black box” test cases 
• Code-based structural test cases 
• Historical test cases 
• Fuzzing 
• Web app scanners, if applicable 
• Address included code (libraries, packages, services) 
The document does not address the totality of software verification, but instead recom-
mends techniques that are broadly applicable and form the minimum standards

HOW TO START AN APP BUSINESS IN 10 STEPS (2)Step 3. Platform choice.In earlier years developers had to choose between Blackberry, Symbian, Windows Phone, iOS, Android. Now things got easier and you should seriously regard only the last three.In some way, even the last two, cause Windows Phone and apps for it couldn’t gain much popularity during the past few years. For instance, nowadays tens of millions of smartphones run Windows, compared to hundreds of millions on iOS and Android. And it doesn’t seem that things are getting better as lately, Windows was more concentrated on mixed reality.So we have Android and iOS devices left. There is a great difference between their app stores.If we look at statistics the image is quite clear. During the last years, Google Play remains a leader in annual downloads with 63 billion downloads in 2016. Third-party Android stores follow with 45 billion. At the same time, Apple App Store had only 29 billion annual downloads.However, the picture changes if we look at annual revenue. Here Apple remains the leader with 34 billion dollars in 2016. Google Play alone got 17 billion and third-party stores – only 10. Due to the experts in 2021, Apple will still remain the leader, although the combination of Google Store and third-party stores will exceed iOS even this year.Also, Apple App Store tends to have higher prices. So here you should think about your monetization strategy. If you’re going to sell your apps iOS will be a better decision, while Android apps can work better with an advertisement.By the way, we must also remind you about web applications. Those are quite universal and cheaper to develop. But they can’t fully compete with native apps and therefore we wouldn’t recommend them for starting your app business.Step 4. Development.After choosing a type of the app you can look for reliable partners to work with. Actually, this stage is more about team building. Depending on your goals you’ll need various coders, designers, copywriters or even photographers. The key thing here is to find people for long-lasting cooperation.You have few possibilities to find needed developers:Get an offshore freelancer.On services like Upwork or Guru, you can find the needed person. Competition between independent programmers is quite high, so rates there tend to be lower. However, their work usually takes more time and there is a risk that your app will not be ended or will have bugs.Also developing an app requires at least two people: one developer and one designer. If you hire freelancers there is a chance they wouldn’t be able to make a good team. Besides, remember that apps will also need support in future.TALK TO OUR TEAMWebsite: https://lnkd.in/gH7ajJSEmail: info@codelynx.io#softwaredevelopment#softwaredeveloper#softwareeducation#codelynx#codelynxdevelopmentapp#educationsoftware#partnership #cooperation

When we choose a #wallet for holding cryptocurrencies, we often focus on press reviews and visual design. But the most important thing is what is inside the wallet ???There are 2 types of apps:??? Open source code?? Closed source code?Open source allows you to make sure that a wallet works as stated in the documentation. But if we use an application with closed code, then there are doubts about the transparency and of this wallet.?In #crypto, it is believed that the wallet should have an open-source code. It's necessary for convincing users of the safety of their funds ???The closed code indicates the lack of confidence of developers in eliminating all bugs. If you put such code on open resource, then in the case of error detection, a hacker can attack #app successfully??Why are closed-source #cryptocurrency wallets dangerous??The creators of such wallets don't take responsibility for the loss of user funds. If the developers are unknown (as Exodus or Electron Cash), then there will be no one to file a lawsuit against, and if they're known, then it's possible to receive compensation only if you have money and an international lawyer.?Let's look at several wallets for an example ???The Exodus wallet has an attractive design, simple functionality and it's very convenient, but it has a closed source code. The developers of the wallet don't give direct explanations about the cases of hacking.?Another example is the multifunctional Electrum Wallet, whose outer look and convenience are less attractive for users, but it is significantly ahead of Exodus in security.?What to choose??Not convenient, but secure Electrum, which takes time to understand, or attractive Exodus, where all operations can be done in a couple of clicks.??? Probably most beginners will prefer Exodus, rather than spend time understanding the complex and incomprehensible Electrum.?FORSAGE recommends avoiding using closed source wallets. But if the desire is too great, then don't keep all crypto in one wallet, use it for small payments and transfers.?Next week, we will talk about the most secure wallets where you can store most part of your funds ??#forsage # #blockchain #cybersecurity #privacy #payments #dataprivacy #cybercrime #safety #money #job #jobseekersonly

3 ?? Tips for creating a SaaS platform?????? 1?? Find an ideaResearch is one of the most important steps you should take to ensure the success of your SaaS product. While this recommendation may seem too trite to be useful, make sure you follow it.In our experience, the best way to do research is to have an idea. In the initial state, you may not have a concrete idea for the software you want to create. And the best way to find it is to look at yourself, your friends or family. This can give you a useful indication and help you develop a SaaS solution with which you can solve some of your or your loved ones' problems. Maybe you are currently working with a software application and you are not satisfied with the way it performs tasks. Maybe you think that this particular SaaS application can benefit from this or that feature. If you think like that, don't hesitate to take this opportunity, because chances are you're not the only one having problems with this software.2?? Validate the viability of your productOnce you have found the idea, you need to validate it. If you don't, other people can benefit from it. And you'll eventually find out that no one really wants it. The best way to validate the idea is to go check Facebook groups for Amazon, provided you intend to create an Amazon-based solution.It is also desirable that you produce a minimum viable product (MVP) and see how your target audience will react to your application. Some developers test their fundamental hypothesis, their assumptions without even creating the most basic version of a SaaS application. 3?? Attracting customersIf you want to launch your SaaS app business and gain more customers, consider doing the following.Get rid of your free plans. If your product has a lower price point, you might want to consider a trial model instead. As a result, you can see a significant increase in customer conversions by letting them try before they buy. This model improves the quality of leads and customers, while free plans tend to attract many people with questions and complaints.Shorten the trial period of your application. Most trials last 30 days. Yet some extend beyond 60 and even 90 days, which is not a good idea. Your customer won't discover anything about your software in four weeks that he couldn't discover in one. So make sure you don't delay your customer's buying decision with your misguided software trial policy. We've found that 14-day trials are enough to get your SaaS application to engage a prospect for a limited time. The short window of use encourages customers to add a greater sense of urgency to the purchase decision.Offer prepaid annual contracts. Give your customers the option to prepay the full value of the service year. Offer them a discount and take advantage of your revenue spike.#saas #startups #software #amazon #aws #mvp #crm #digitalagency

Telemedicine apps give remote doctor visits, and enhance the efficiency of medical service. Plus, virtual visits are typically less expensive than in-person consultations.? Self-monitoring apps help to improve patient self-management and self-efficacy by monitoring and analyzing data during one treatment period, pregnancy or others. The tool comes with recommendations, improving medication-taking behavior, health services utilization, identification of adverse effects, overall health status, and patient satisfaction.
