In case you missed it, Adam Mosseri (Head of Instagram) gave an update last week on the future of the platform. It’s interesting to see such an open and honest approach to the development plans for Instagram.Here's a quick summary from our Head of Creative, James Pierechod.?? They are embracing the power of creatorsThis recognises the value of individuals (vs institutions) on Instagram and trying to help them make a living. We may even see a change in the algorithm and weighting for influencers to put more focus on the person, content and community.?? They are doubling down on mobile-first videoA bold statement and clear move away from being “just a square photo-sharing app”. With research proving that people use Instagram to be entertained, creating video content that’s immersive and truly engaging will be more important than ever.It also appears that Instagram want to shift more towards recommendations and suggestions (less about followers) – although we wonder how much this has been inspired by the rapid rise of TikTok.?? They are leaning into the change in shopping from offline to onlineNo surprise here, given how much the pandemic has accelerated the rate of change in commerce. Likely to see a ramp up in interactive connections and experiences in e-commerce (and we’re intrigued to see how that overlaps with video).?? They are looking more at messaging (over Feed and Stories)Probably a reference to the advertising and engagement potential of dark social (those interactions that can’t be fully tracked). The power of a recommendation is far greater in messaging than Feed or Stories, and we expect this will be supported by data from Facebook Messenger too.So, plenty to be aware of here. Of course, we’ll be keeping a close eye on how things develop and helping clients get the best out of it for their brand.We’d love to hear what you think about these changes – whether that's from your own experience, or the expectations of your brand and audience when using Instagram.

At the beginning of this year, I was leaving my first job after ten years to become a full-time coach. This meant changing my living conditions and my lifestyle.In the meantime, I was also training for my first half Ironman race. I had too much on my plate and I knew I will need superpowers to navigate this challenging time.My fellow coaches suggested that I take the Positive Intelligence 6-Week-Program. I was skeptical at the beginning. It felt like your typical American recipe for success. The kind that you avoid without looking at it.However, because of the referrals, I decided to embark on this journey and it was truly transformational.The program is built on the concept of Saboteurs. The inner critic voices are constantly trying to sabotage you to reach your potential and goals. After identifying your saboteurs, it focuses on developing your inner sage or inner coach that tunes down the saboteur voices in your head.The great thing about the program is that you also have access to the PQ App, designed to measure your mental fitness throughout the six weeks. The app also offers daily reflections and coach challenges meant to keep you in the loop throughout the program.More about the science behind the app here: https://lnkd.in/eHEcGfHOne thing that I am grateful for is the overall sense of 'ease and flow' I developed during the program. Also on a more exact note throughout the six weeks I managed to:- Gain a better understanding of my limiting beliefs and patterns- Work on family conflicts that I was avoiding for a long time- Make a smooth transition from Marketing Coordinator to Transformational Coach- Land my first clients as a coach- Develop the mental muscles necessary for completing my first half Ironman raceThis might seem a lot but I truly believe that this program is effective. I especially recommend it to people who are multi-passionate, high-performing individuals looking for a personalized learning experience that will have a long-lasting impact on the way they work and live.Also, I am happy to share with you that starting of July, I am conducting this program as a PQ Coach. If you are curious about the mental fitness journey or you already decided to enter this program, feel free to contact me via message for further details and enrollment.#coaching #mentalfitness #positiveintelligence #easeandflow

#Education TV in #Pakistan has been made available as on demand content on program websites, YouTube channels, and #mobile apps. #Punjab developed animated teacher characters for TV lessons (Miss DNA, Mr. Khawarizmi, and Miss Curie). “The biggest challenge was the disengagement of children from academic learning… The biggest question was—‘how will the children learn’? We started looking at what existed and what we could start immediately,” stated Umbreen Arif, Technical Advisor to the Pakistan Ministry of???? Federal Education and Professional Training, who led TeleSchool.Public school teachers, subject experts, and timetabling specialists were leveraged to develop TV lessons and scripts for broadcasting aligned to the national and provincial curricula, and to curate existing educational content. Teachers also supported mass communication campaigns by appearing on TV network morning shows.School closures as a result of the pandemic affected more than 30 million children in Pakistan, including approximately 12 million children in Punjab.  To ensure the continuity of #learning, the country turned to #educational technology (EdTech) tools like TV, #radio, and #mobile phones. Almost all of Pakistan (95 percent) and Punjab (90 percent) had access to TV, so this became the most viable option for #remote learning for students and for teacher training.A Gallup Pakistan Rapid Assessment was conducted in May 2020 to measure the short-term impact of #TeleSchool regarding awareness, viewership, perceived quality, and #loyalty. Within two months, 1,200 #households with children ranging five to fifteen years of age in Pakistan were telephonically surveyed: nearly one in every three Pakistanis surveyed said they had accessed TeleSchool lessons (with the highest proportion from Punjab), with an estimated weekly viewership of six million children. Seventy-seven percent were either satisfied or somewhat satisfied with TeleSchool #lessons, with #rural respondents more satisfied than their urban counterparts. 66 percent of parents surveyed said they would recommend TeleSchool to other parents.Source : https://lnkd.in/eig-Wj8

Cyber security researchers discovered that there are 9 malicious apps on Google Play Store! They are stealing Facebook users’ credentials…The researchers detected some apps stealing Facebook users’ credentials then they reported the issue to Google. After confirming malicious apps they are removed from Google Play Store. The apps are very functional and they look safe for a standard user. The reported apps are are given below:- Processing Photo- App Lock Keep- Rubbish Cleaner- Horoscope Daily- Horoscope Pi- App Lock Manager- Lockit Master- Inwell Fitness- PIP PhotoIf you use these apps it is strongly recommended to uninstall them and change your Facebook account’s password. Also ThreatMonIT recommends enabling 2FA.ThreatMonIT recommends that you use only trusted and known developers’ apps. Also you should read the privacy policy of apps carefully and you should read app reviews.#cybersecurity #android #privacy #hacking #facebook #google #malware #MaliciousApps # #infosec #security #phishing #informationsecurity

Continuing from my 2nd post on NO CODE or LOW CODE Apps and Webpage Development....From 2nd post onwards, I will publish some Apps one by one, showing the possibilities of Apps developed with NO CODE or LOW CODEIn the 2nd post, I presented an Apps on work place safety. An example where Apps can be used internally, to assist EHS team when carry out safety audit, it also makes it easy for employee to report near misses or risk. Since it can be done on the spot, it save times of filling up forms, transfer the information to computer (Excel, or word or ..).  The data can also be presented in Pie / Bar Chart if required. Someone asks about the data, storage and etc. There are many NO CODE or LOW CODE Apps platforms available online. Each has their own way of handling the databases. The one I choose, use Google Sheet as the source of data. It means all data will be store in Google Drive. You can also use One Drive, Microsoft One Note and etc. Google Drive is just my personal preferences. The file size is not too much a concern here. However, I don’t recommend running database with too huge file size. My experience running nearly 10K rows of data in Google Sheet is still quite smooth. The features available will depend on whether you are using free or paid version of the platform. So far for my ex-company, we have been surviving with a free version for 1 year. Let’s continue with the next Apps I will be putting up here. It is a simple field service Apps where you can record field service activity so that we can, together will a simple field report. During weekend catchup with few of my friends who work in traditional app build support, they were asking what I need to do to shift and jump start career in Data and AI.  #weforum  has predicted top 3 increase in demand are for Data Analysts, Data Science (AI,ML) and Data Engineers. https://lnkd.in/duNR9wW Nothing comes easy in life but here are few things you could from my perspective to be relevant in current world of #dataandai1.      Math and Mindset – Generate interest towards #math and apply analytical mindset in your day to day life. Data Analysts don’t approach a problem with preconceived mindset, we work with data to draw conclusion or recommend decisions. Always learn to ask questions before taking a stance.2.      Learn to code – It is critical to have ability to read, write, analyze #data and #code. In today’s world Data Engineers is one of the highest paid salary (even higher than Data Scientist in some cases). You can pick Python, Scala or any Cloud (AWS, Azure or GCP) to cross or up-skill yourself3.      Research, Experiment & Network – Analytics and AI can be applied in every field including health care, food industry, space etc. Pick your area of interest and do appropriate research of applicability, POV’s. Do experimentation on your own cloud accounts and connect with relevant people in the field to hear and learn real experiences.4.      Skill development – Data Analytics is not just coding, you can be an Analyst, product owner, Sales executive, Functional SME, Statistician and many more. Until you have an appetite to understand the data and contextualize the information to your area then you have a role to play.5.      Education – Having right education will help enormously if you are starting your career just now or even trying to change. Universities are offering full time courses, short certifications in various fields of Data Analytics. Having one of these along with any cloud certifications will provide ton of confidence for yourself.Thomas Alva Edison once said – Opportunity is missed by most people because it comes dressed in overalls and looks like work. #dataandanalytics #ai #dataengineering #machinelearning #datacareer #carreer #aravsays

The series "Our favourite tools for online training", continues with Robert Klein's digital flip charts. He says: "Over the last couple of months, I needed to find a good tool for online facilitation. Although I am not an artist I always liked to work with flip charts and visualize content of my workshops. The challenge was to find a tool which can be used to write digitally, now as well as, for upcoming in person trainings after the corona pandemic.For me, Procreate is it!An easy to use app which can be used for creating flyers as well as a digital flip chart during the online workshop. As added value, the generated posters can be sent to a printing house and used for live-in-person session when needed. It's perfect for both worlds: remote and in-person workshops which reduces the workload quite a bit.The app is easy to use and my participants like to be part of the just-in-time development of content. The look is fresh and can be easy adjusted for different groups and customers. Knowing that I probably use only 10% of the Procreate potential I can really recommend the app. It helped me a lot to stay motivated, develop new things and try a different approach."#moveonMonday #online #training

Supply Chain Hack- Demystified #DeadlyhackThe recent Solar Winds hack is unique, very clever, deadliest and one of its kind.Solar Winds is an networking product.  Probably it gathers the health of nodes/computers and tries to present them in a dashboard. Such tools also have hot fixes, Updates/Upgrades, like any software app.The clever thing in this hack is that the hacker exploits the trust that network admins have to Auto approve and accept, change that come from Solar Winds/ Similar apps. This is the reason it's called supply chain hack. A true "Trojan Horse".Another devilish uniqueness, is that the viral payload is very small and it gets inserted at the very last step in the software build process just before the checksum seal is stamped on the build #software. Making detection a big challenge.https://lnkd.in/d5U8P8W. Thanks to NPR. I drew my understanding about this from NPR and security wonks like Shakthi Sivaramakrishnan, CISA, CISM Once infected, it gives the perpetrator the power to choose to release the attack vector, any time in future. Like invoking a sleeper cell.Now how does one protect themselves from such hacks?The answer is "Zero Trust". Basically you should not trust even your own wife!!! :-). Any software update by any vendor in your eco- system,  should be quarantined and thoroughly checked before giving authorization for Update/ Upgrade. This path is not without Risks, and would call for big process changes. But yes we can mitigate future attacks.As they say, if there is a will there's a way. #kudos to our President Biden and Whitehouse to strategize and come up with recommendations for companies to follow. Now all vendors of Federal Government are under vigilant hawk eye before they are allowed to sneeze??.Pun intended..in these covid times...he..heBut I am still looking for answers on how to detect if you are already infected. The hacker sleeper cell is already part of you. Then what???Such attacks will need $$ and muscle to develop. I deplore all Nation States who takes this cudgel to refrain from such activities. $$$ (CEO's/ CIO's please note and open your wallets and eqiup your ISRM folks to safeguard your company)In my view  this is the nuclear option in cyber attacks.So friends nothing is safe anymore. We are all deep trouble. Leaving you now with heavy heart...

Benefits of  4 Customer Engagement Metrics for your Business.1. Customer Satisfaction ScoreAlmost 80% of marketers want to prioritize improving customer retention and satisfaction. Start tracking your customer satisfaction score (CSAT). The CSAT will determine how pleased customers are with a product or service.You can measure the CSAT by using questions from a customer feedback survey.In some ways, the CSAT is similar to the net promoter score (NPS). The NPS measures loyalty, though. CSAT, as the name suggests, measures satisfaction.When developing a customer survey, you can ask, “How would you rate your overall satisfaction with our service?” Most companies create a scale:Very UnsatisfiedUnsatisfiedNeutralSatisfiedVery SatisfiedTo calculate your average, look at the number of satisfied and very satisfied customers. Then, divide that total by how many responses you received.2. Net Promoter ScoreYour Net Promoter Score (NPS) can tell you how likely a customer would recommend a product to their friends. A strong NPS could indicate a strong word-of-mouth marketing strategy. A product recommendation could help you reach new customers.It could also indicate brand loyalty with your existing customers.Loyalty is sometimes worth 10 times as much as a single purchase, too. Meanwhile, 60% of consumers prefer to purchase from familiar brands.Improving your brand relationships can boost retention rates, improving your ROI.You can calculate this metric as you engage consumers using in-app surveys.NPS equals the percentage of people eager to promote your business (promoters) minus those who aren’t (detractors).3. Churn RateChurn rate is a user engagement metric. It’s the percentage of clients who cut ties from your brand during a given period. The lower your churn rate, the more customers you retain.A lower churn rate could indicate a strong customer experience. It could also indicate your marketing efforts are excelling.Otherwise, you need to determine why, where, and when your customers disappear.You can calculate your churn rate by subtracting the number of clients at the end of a cycle from the initial number of clients. Then, divide that by the number of clients at the beginning of the time period. Multiply by 100% to get your total.The lower the churn rate, the higher the retention rate. This indicates satisfactory customer engagement.4. Customer Lifetime ValueThe Customer Lifetime Value (CTLV) measures the amount of revenue you can expect from a client during the span of your relationship. The longer a client continues purchasing from your business, the higher their CLTV.To calculate CLTV, you need to first determine the lifetime value. LTV equals the average purchase value multiplied by the number of transactions. Then, multiply that total by the retention time period.To calculate CLTV, multiply the LTV by the profit margin.Aderonke Salami Seun Odegbami Idowu Ayeni (SSGB) (ISO Certified)

Today, I'd like to share a couple of personal development/growth insights with all of you that I've recently acquired.The first insight I acquired is a productivity & notetaking system called "Notion" that I'd highly recommend to anyone looking to become more organized in their personal and/or professional lives (if not already doing so).I'm still very new to the system, but I've gone through many videos on it and how different people use it (content creators and working professionals), and I've started building out my own.  Additionally, to help incentivize trying/using it, if you're still in school and have access to a school email account (.edu), you can get the Personal Pro access for FREE for as long as you have your school email account.  And, even if you don't have such access, the Personal Pro plan is actually very cheap, and I'd say very worth it.That all aside, if you're interested in learning more about "Notion," I'd suggest that you check out two YouTubers' videos on it to learn more:•  Thomas Frank >>> (https://lnkd.in/eWyATMA)•  Ali Abdaal >>> (https://lnkd.in/ehdx_DZ)The second insight I acquired is the concept of using an "automated flow system" for content/information consumption.  This "system" is essentially a digital method by which you log and review content and insights you've acquired through watching things on YouTube, reading articles and posts online, or listening to podcasts (as the most common examples).Most if not all of us "consume" mass amounts of content/information daily, but I don't know many (including myself) who have an effective method of "properly" capturing and reflecting on what we learn; this is a cognitive trap known as "overconsumption," whereby we keep consuming information each day to the point that we retain very little (if any) of most of it, which results in waste of effort and time.  Again, this is where an "automated flow system" designed to help us capture and reflect on what we learn/consume would help.And, in order to effectively use such a system, we obviously have to reduce the friction between what it is and how it integrates into our daily lives; enter Ali Abdaal (once again) with the five tools he uses and how he automates them all "dumping" into what's known as a "Second Brain."That said, Ali would be able to explain this far better than I presently can, so feel free to check out his video (linked below) if you have about 11 mins to spare.And lastly, as always, I wish you all the best in your personal and professional journeys, and I hope you have a great week!!#neverstoplearning #productivity #clearmindclearlife

Hosted a very interesting meet-up conducted today by Hello Meets, where Rahul Jain, the guest speaker, spoke about How to Choose the Best Tech Stack for Startups.Rahul says, “If you are in a startup, optimize for speedy innovations.”Key Takeaways:·       Use the first principle, i.e., identify the problem/ goal and go with it. It saves time and effort.·       One of the major challenges for early-stage startups is resources.·       High recommendation of the serverless stack over dedicated servers.    Things to Keep in Mind for choosing Frontend Stack for Web:1.    Community2.    Scalability Constraints3.    Language Familiarity To choose between developing a Website or an App first, keep in mind:1.    Frequency Use2.    Native APIs/ Local Data3.    Where are your customers and why?4.    What does the customer prefer using Additional things to look out for:1.    Analytics2.    Customer re-engagement3.    Authentication4.    Crashlytics

How to raise the adoption rate of #sustainablemobility apps in France? This is the question Cyrille TETOUGUENI and I had the privilege to study while interviewing 30 industry experts, on behalf of BNP Paribas & the Movin'On Connect Community.We noticed 4 Trends affecting greater speed of maas:(TLDR: B2C Maas is a blood bath. Governments should work directly with businesses to solve for distribution with lower CAC:  A G2B2C Franchise Model).1. B2C would be an absolute bloodbath in France due to a highly fragmented competitive landscape of all the mobility players (Tier, Velib, Lime, Bus, Train etc all competing for the same consumer dollars.2. Mobility service providers were expanding horizontally to include multiple transportation options. Eg. Uber listing public transport options (frienemy relationship?). But there was no app that was truly taking care of the customer experience -like Amazon where I could buy a bunch of ticket 'products' with a single payment. 3. Deep linking vs. Deep integration appeared to be a major defensibility mechanism. In ecommerce it was the equivalent of committing to a channel management strategy or simply leaving a affiliate link on someone else's site and developing your own brand.com. The answer is both channels have to be robust to capture as many users as possible! But mobility still very siloed in France. Indicator of a hyper fragmented and newish landscape.4. Data privacy is a major blocker between mobility mash-ups of public transportation x private MSPs. Public transportation actors are reluctant to open up their backdoor to anyone (though in Nordic countries, full business competition is encouraged). For public actors, it appeared that owning the end user was important since the want to demonstrate tax payer value through mobility. Proposed SolutionTo encourage lower CAC (customer aquaition costs) & better UX we recommended a G2B2C Franchise Model - where the public player acted as Franchisor, ie. App + brand owner+standards setting. They licenced out the product to the "B": Employers & Residential managers (or a third party who can manage it) in exchange for distribution to their employees/residents, brand equity, data standards, sustainability goals. Like this Gov' could do what they do best: Financing and setting the rules! Without having to worry about distribution. As for biz, it would be cheaper than building on your own app because the gov' contract has the benefit of scale to negotiate lower rates with the tech provider. Biz would also be able to crack the iron wall of public transportation - having access to ticketing back-end here that, so far has been exclusive only to public transport apps making a much more seamless UX for the 30m employees in France. Lastly, it would be a plug and play solution equipped with everything you need to get that tax break. Only 20 pages left of a report and I'm done my MBA!  Looking forward to your feedback here, and thanks to everyone today!

looking out for an web designer minimum experience of four to five years specialised in web designing and any degree with a good package offered. Web Designer duties and responsibilities of the jobRequiring both technical and creative skills, a Web Designer job description typically includes some of these tasks and duties:Designing engaging and responsive landing pagesIntegrating client CMS programs and data feeds into websitesOptimising sites for maximum speed and scalabilityEmploying industry and design best practice through website build processConducting website testingLiaising with back-end developers to ensure web and app logic is properly integratedEnsuring website function and stability across devices i.e. desktop, mobile, tabletWorking with marketing and research teams to incorporate brand elements and relevant market research findings into websiteProviding internal support and external customer service throughout the build and launch process of the websiteWeb Designer job qualifications and requirementsCertificates, diplomas and degrees can all be cited as ‘preferred’ in a Web Designer job description, and are not essential. It is common for web design candidates to be self-taught, or have completed on-the-job training to develop key skills and gain experience with specialised applications. If a formal qualification is requested, the relevant areas of study are:Web DesignDigital MediaInformation TechnologyScience or Computer ScienceGraphic DesignIt is however critical to list the software and programs that candidates need to be proficient in. Some of these are listed below. Requesting a minimum of three years’ experience is also recommended.HTMLCSSjQueryJavaScriptAdobe Suite – Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesignAPI web integrationExperience in User Experience (UX) and User Interface (UI)

Fast - Accurate - SimpleYou select two out for performance optimization. The temporary malfunction of a crypto app is a good example for fast and simple choice. Look at the trillion dollar smile over night, even if it's a fault signal. The accuracy is not necessary important in client and investor minds because they have low tolerance for consistency in development process, especially, an app could involves a certain number of specialized developers/software engineers. Normally, there's a saying "numbers lie".That doesn't mean all crypto app is bad performance or lacking work ethic. Personally, I am not investing into crypto since the born of Bitcoin notice so no recommendation of a secured platform to name here.From analytics background - benchmarking and performance evaluation of the Area Under Curve (AUC) work, this type of malfunction is wild because your (business) model supposes to perform around 95 percentage and above over time. In business statistics, confidence levels of 90/95/99% are frequently used.Typical user requirement would be smooth operation and "when will I get the minimum viable product (production deployment), how about in two weeks!?"If you're in such project, you should ask "do you have a lawyer to handle a risk of getting in a lawsuit?"Write your terms and conditions of using the app service carefully.

A really interesting look at three startups that are "reinventing social media". An insightful piece that sheds light on where social is (potentially) headed. Via 'Digital Native' newsletter.TL;DR*** BeReal is a Paris-based startup that’s taken France by storm over the past few months. As the name suggests, the app is all about being real: every day at a random time, you’re given two minutes to capture a photo of what you’re doing. *** Poparazzi launched last Monday and debuted at #1 on the App Store. The app’s premise is simple: you take photos of your friends, and they take photos of you. Your profile shows both pictures you’ve “popped” of friends and pictures your friends have popped of you.*** Dispo’s tagline is “Live in the Moment”. The app replicates the concept of a disposable camera. You open the app and take photos, then wait for the photos to “develop” at 9am the next day.Want to dig deeper? (RECOMMENDED) ---> https://lnkd.in/gFzrybx#socialmedia #technologynews

Having been an Android & iOS native developer for a while, i naturally brushed off cross platform technologies for as long as i could. Eventually React Native piqued my interest so i gave it a go...& it's good & actually easier. I chose to rebuild one of my natively aesthetically challenging projects, dived in and published it to both Google Play & Apple App stores. You can have a look here: Android: https://bit.ly/3gZyWyuiOS: https://apple.co/35NolBxcompared to the original:Android: http://bit.ly/2FNKVgliOS: https://apple.co/3gDFkubAs long as your project isn't insanely dependent on native APIs - e.g utility apps (Media players, antivirus apps), & resource intensive (even though there are probable workarounds), i would recommend giving it a try.NB: There's also all the buzz about Redux (among others) - a state container for React apps. I would suggest laying off it if you're just beginning, but if you want a start you can check out my GitHub at https://lnkd.in/dwkEzNZ  for a simple demo project #android #ios #react #apps

Hello AllHope you all are doing great.Last week we caught up with some really interesting updates on top platforms like Google, Instagram, etc. So don’t forget to check those 8 updates if you haven’t already.And with a new week comes new updates, so here are this week’s1. Instagram launches test of video and image uploads from the desktop versionAfter developing for a few months, Instagram has now launched the live test of its video and image upload options via the platform's desktop version. The option is currently available for a small group of people who have access to the entire publishing suite. This update will streamline the publishing process for brand/social media managers, making it easier for them to take posts live directly from their systems.2. Instagram is testing content recommendations within the main feedLast year, Instagram added a "suggested posts" listing at the end of a long scroll on your Instagram feed. After testing this for quite some time, the platform, based on the response and engagement with the recommended content, is now looking to highlight and display more accounts, topics, and posts of interest. According to The Verge, "Suggested posts will be mixed throughout your primary feed, sometimes ahead of photos and videos from people you follow." Along with this, Instagram is also adding new control options with which users can add or remove topics of interest.3. Facebook rolls out live audio rooms and in-stream podcast playback in the USBoth Live Audio Rooms and Podcasts have been in testing on Facebook for a while, and now, the social media platform has officially rolled out Live Audio Rooms and in-stream Podcast discovery and playback within the app.4. Twitter announces the launch of the option of sharing Tweets to Instagram Stories for iOs5. Facebook tests Reels and Rooms display within the Facebook appFacebook is looking to boost accessibility to Reels and Rooms, and in the wake of this, the platform is testing the display of Reels and Rooms within the Facebook app. Facebook is currently testing the display of Reels and Rooms right above its Stories panel, where users would be given two options - Reels and Rooms - they can tap on.6. Google rolls out new "Spam Algorithm" updateGoogle confirms the rollout of a spam-related algorithm update on June 23rd, 2021. Google's Danny Sullivan confirms an algorithm update targeted at fighting spam is rolling out to search results. Exact details were not provided about this specific update. Though Google regularly rolls out spam updates to maintain the quality of its search results.7. Google Web Stories reaches the 100K per day milestone8. Google is now showing "Reliable Sources" prompt on Trending SearchesGoogle is showing a new prompt on trending searches when there aren't enough reliable sources. Google is testing a new prompt on trending searches that do not have enough reliable sources.#instagram #google

The high price of Context Switching For Makers & Ways to Avoid ItMakers and Developers don’t like to be interrupted. Ever wonder why? Well, the one-line answer is, “Context Switching is super hard!”?? Context switching is expensiveSwitching contexts has a very high cost on people who do deep work. Jason Heeris illustrates with an interesting example what damage a simple ping can do to the developer’s flow.https://lnkd.in/eV9pZUs?? Cost of interruptionsChris Parnin looked at the cost of interrupting developers, and made some powerful observations:?? A programmer takes between 10–15 minutes to start editing code after resuming work from an interruption.?? An interrupted task is estimated to take twice as long and contain twice as many errors as uninterrupted tasks.?? A programmer is likely to get just one uninterrupted 2-hour session in a day.?? Meetings are the biggest source of interruptionsAs Paul Graham wrote in his seminal 2009 essay:“A single meeting can blow a whole afternoon, by breaking it into two pieces each too small to do anything hard in. Plus you have to remember to go to the meeting. For someone on the maker's schedule, having a meeting is like throwing an exception. It doesn't merely cause you to switch from one task to another; it changes the mode in which you work.”?? Techniques to minimize context switchingWe can find flow in the world of constant interruptions. Here are some approaches, used by the most productive developers across the world, that we like:?? Time blockingDivide your workday into blocks of time. Each block should have the goal of completing a specific task.?? Time batchingDoing similar tasks together in a batch reduces context switching and increases efficiency. Eg. Doing all code reviews together, or answering all emails and slack messages together once or twice a day.?? Turning off notifications during deep work?? PrioritizationFocus on tasks that can have the most meaningful impact. Don't get lost trying to tackle a laundry list of seemingly urgent tasks. Jeff Bezos says that his secret is making fewer, better decisions, and thinking long-term.?? Eating that FrogBrian Tracy, author of Eat That Frog, recommends tackling the biggest task first thing each morning. You must develop the routine of “eating your frog” before you do anything else. Frog is a metaphor for your biggest, most important task. Also if you have two frogs, eat the ‘ugliest’ one first.?? Adopt Async Communication~~~Read the complete blog at: https://lnkd.in/eXEa4C8 #productivity #makers #founders?? If your team is on Slack, then check out Paco | www.pacohq.com, the new trending Slack productivity app that helps Makers to go async on Slack, hence reducing the need to interrupt their flow.

After four years of chipping away, we finally secured a resolution to grant permission for a detached dwelling, at a rear garden to serve Supported Living. Unanimous approval at Test Valley’s Southern Area Committee, overcoming two failed pre-apps, followed by an unproductive planning meeting, withdrawn application, resubmitted revised scheme, refused application on design, dismissed at appeal. However the Planning Inspectorate agreed the siting of the proposed dwelling was considered acceptable and the design would enhance the character of the area. Armed with the Inspectorate‘s response the Free Go application to consider the outstanding matter of Parking & Nitrates mitigation, saw unanimous committee approval despite overwhelming local objections led by the parish council. All this for one dwelling! One would be mistaken for thinking we were proposing a major development! We can take comfort from the Inspector’s Appeal response disagreeing with the Local Authorities views on design and recognised the development was cited within the settlement Boundary. Only nitrates and parking remained as the subject of the application, all other considerations met and an officer recommendation for approval at committee. Our thanks to the team for the hard work involved and those who supported our application. The determination and perseverance of all including heavy campaigning by the applicant, will be at the benefit of residents with Asperger who have desperately required much needed accommodation for supported living, will help young people’s development of social skills, guide their interests and contribute to the local community, in a quiet rural setting; an important factor with this level of quality care for a calm relaxed environment. PAL Primary Access Care ltd is a preferred provider of Supported Living by Hampshire County Council, working collaboration with MENCAP dealing with mental illnesses, physical and learning disabilities. Primary Access Limited specialise in caring for Alzheimer’s, Dementia, and Autism.We are looking forward to commencing construction in the coming months. Planning Consultant - Tony Huggett M.R.T.P.IArchitect - Jose Mayorga BA (Hons) DIPArch RIBAPrimary Access Care Ltd - Mr & Mrs BryantLester Aldridge - Conveyancing Garrett & Sons Builders, Braishfield Romsey#planningapplication #planningpermission #supportedliving #Housing #learningdisabilities #aspergers #autism #romsey #Planning #Committee #Approval #nitrates #testvalley

I remember catching a first glimpse of our “Home” app like 3 years ago. Around that time, Caitlin joined Xplor Education and started pushing more content to LinkedIn. I’m not a parent and had little idea of what Xplor did. Back then it was just another start-up to me but seeing that first product demo truly impressed me. The UI looked great and you could tell how useful Home would be for parents to have on their phones. Fast forward, I know a little bit more about Xplor, duh ;) Our product suite has come a long way and has never been better. Every Friday I join our town halls and showcases and I’m blown away by what our teams build – week after week. Our latest addition to our platform is going to be a game-changer for many. We just added Parenting Content – That’s basically Netflix for parents. They can now explore a library of educational content about their child's development. We’ve got videos, articles and podcasts that range across 9 themes for them to browse: Nutrition, Behaviour, Communication, Sleep, Growth & Development, Toileting, First-Aid & Safety, Dad's & Partners, Parenting & Work. Parents can also view content recommended by their child's educators. Couldn’t be prouder to be part of the team that is constantly trying to make education better. If you’re an Xplor user and haven’t updated your app yet, please check out the Google Play or iOS App Store.#wearexplor #parentingcontent #lifeatxplor #earlylearning #childcare

Did you know that the professional social networking platform, LinkedIn, has been around longer than the popular social platforms today? You need to keep in mind that these are more relevant than ever.The reason behind this is that this platform accommodates over more than seven hundred million professional profiles. That only suggests an unlimited supply of job opportunities and network connections. LinkedIn is considered a vital part of becoming a full-fledged professional in any sector nowadays, whether you are sustaining your personal brand or looking for a new job.#linkedin #letsgetstarted #fridaytips #onlineprofile #linkedintips #tipskerja

Graduated!??After six years of studying, I have graduated and obtained my master’s degree Culture, Organization, and Management at the VU Amsterdam. Upon graduating, I have been working on my own part-time business which will be expected to launch next month! I am looking forward to sharing this journey with you. Supply Chain Manager (Printing Company) Relocation Help Available--Pittston, PAWe are looking for a talented Supply Chain Manager to join our team specializing in procurement and logistic items for our printing operation in Pittston, PA. Experience in printing and packaging is a plus. Coordinate purchasing of raw materials for the production of printed folding cartons, sleeves and wraps.In this role, you will make an impact in the following ways:• Manage our Pittston, PA supply chain needs for our printing operation.• Responsible for ascertaining forecast information from our customers to determine inventory levels required to support the predictable segment of our business profile.• Determining best methods for ordering paperboard material from our various material suppliers including direct from papermills, from papermill common stocks, and from converters who specialize in supporting medium to lower volume customers (less predictable consumers)• Manage various products including paperboard, inks, varnishes, tooling, printing plate materials and related supplies associated with our printing operation.• Manage our recycling program for scrap which is produced during our die cutting process.• Develop and manage relationships with transit companies (LTL, TL) for both supply chain items coming in and product going out.• Communicate with operations team to assure purchasing requirements are met.• Work with the sales & customer service team to develop forecasts for purposes of proactively managing inventory.• Perform physical inventories to maintain accurate inventory.• Provide inventory information to Finance for monthly accounting requirements.• Knowledge of Microsoft AX, SAP or similar systems is a plus.• Perform research for new vendors for both standard applications and special requirements.• Manage subcontracting vendors who are involved in some of our manufactured products.• Participate in collaboration with our European associates when supply chain items align.Must have very good knowledge of technology to include computers and software programs such as MS Office, spreadsheets, and Microsoft Teams.

30th June 2021 was my last working day at Mindtree, after a memorable 5 years 10 months 13 days, I feel a deep sense of gratitude and humility. When I joined this organisation in August 2015, little did I know that I was going to embark in one of the mostly exhilarating phase of my life, a journey of self-discovery, an experiment in expanding my horizons and taking on world-class competitors and learnings from the best in the industryI would like to thank Mindtree founders - Subroto Bagchi Krishnakumar Natarajan, Parthasarathy N.S.Rostow Ravanan (he/him) for creating such a great institution.I would also like to thank my Business Leaders who believed in me at every stage of this journey,  guided and supported me all these years , Arun Rangaraju , Rajesh Baliga, Sudeep Biswas, Nagesh VS, Karthikeyan Ramasubramanian and Anil Rao. A special thanks to my Technology Heads Lloyd Palfrey and Chris Kernaghan. A single post can never be enough/justify to several other leaders and wonderful colleagues who have supported me through this journey but can not end this without thanking my own team - A very very special thanks to my SAP DT CoE Team for their support and belief in me – a captain is only as good as his team.I am super excited to share that I am starting my new professional journey with SoftwareOne as SAP Head India, Sri Lanka and Middle-East to learn and explore new areas within Enterprise Technology space and beyond. Ready for the next set of challenges, however, what’s life without them. Looking forward for another exciting and learning journey with SoftwareOne.

How to apply #ProcessMining in general and for #RPA in particular (following my speech at the RPA21 conf).Let's say we have a telco, bank or industrial company. How to start Process Mining and RPA?First task is simple but difficult to implement: we need to get a clear picture of what is happening: what are the functions and processes, what is the efficiency of stuff who performs them, etc. This task is divided into the steps:1/ It is necessary to audit the subject area and data sources.2/ Further, based on these sources, we create data mart, so that it fully shows what stuff are doing.3/ Further, these we need to create and implement a schedulers and infrastructure for updating and maintenance (CI/CD).4/ Next, it is necessary to introduce prisms (metrics) through which we look at these processes.These steps will allow further to A) structure processes and understand the efficiency of work within each process / function and possibilities for increasing this efficiency; B) analyze & identify functions which can and should be automated; C) in the context of industrial companies, this also allows us to understand and form the requirements for complete infrastructure "Sensors - Connectivity - Integration Platform - #ml Services"  #digitaltransformation #automation #ivanisaev

You will work intimately with clients through whole project life cycle. Role?      Working in cross-disciplinary team of experts, you will be responsible for the development of Robotic Process Automation solution in various RPA software using .NET & VBA knowledge for our Clients.?      Your responsibilities as a consultant will include not only developing new robotic solutions for the Client, but also the prior assessment, documentation creation and walkthrough on processes dedicated to be automated (confirming feasibility of process automation).?      We expect your involvement and understanding business issues in order to support our clients in in-depth comprehension of key-drivers for their current and future success and solving the strategic and operational problems. I might have created the easiest way to send #Python #Telegram notification. pip install rpa --> import rpa as r --> r.telegram(id, message). Hosting the bot on my VPS server but you can host on yours. Look up @rpapybot to start.Although RPA for Python package runs a forked version of TagUI RPA, this feature is implemented in pure Python 2/3 so it works without any Python dependencies or TagUI. Any Python user can use to send notifications ??In addition, the light and simple 1-file package has following functions written in pure Python 2/3 without dependencies or TagUI. These functions are great time-savers instead of Python users having to write their own.load() - load text filedump() - save text filewrite() - append text fileask() - ask for user inputwait() - wait for some timecheck() - output conditionallydownload() - file from URLunzip() - unzip a zip filerun() - OS level commands.. more info at RPA for Python GitHub repo

If a company wanted to get started with using Robotic Process Automation (RPA), where & how should they begin? https://lnkd.in/eQYrHUMHave you heard of RPA? That is basically software that makes use of ML & AI to do routine manual SCM activities like process a Purchase Order. These processes tend to be manual, tactical, & clerically driven. However, that RPA software is learning from itself on how to do things better, faster, & cheaper. For example, RPA could start saying things like: I think we are paying too much, I think we should be using a different supplier, I think we are ordering in the wrong quantities, etc. The RPA software might actually decide to reopen the contract & have suppliers rebid on the business & the RPA might actually pick the new supplier. Yes, there will likely be human intervention for any activities that are “strategic”.For me, tactical means all the day to day operational grunt work. Strategic to me means the decisions that have to be made with longer term implications & consequences. I have a former student who went on to become a technology consultant & I asked him: if a company wanted to get started with using RPA, where & how should they begin in general? See his response below. Let’s just say the student has become the teacher.Hi Sime: Here are some points on how to approach a new technology investment, based on what I have seen in software & professional services:1. Have a very specific use case for implementing RPA. This requires research on behalf of your company. If you approach it with a general attitude that says, “Let’s have robots do all the work”, you will end up paying a consulting firm loads of money to evaluate your business for RPA opportunities, only to hear them tell you what you could have figured out on your own.2. It would be better to research industry peers to see what they are doing with RPA, THEN engage a consulting firm to help you implement an RPA solution that is focused on specific business processes.If you are looking for general help with where to start on RPA, I would advise against outsourcing the research to consulting/tech firms. It would be best to engage a consulting/tech firm for the implementation of an RPA solution, but not for general advisement on where to start. Most high-level assessments are overly priced in my experience & do not add much value. RPA is a cool technology but I have seen limited adoption with the mid-market companies I work with. It seems more popular with the Fortune 500 because they can afford the investment. In my opinion, companies of ALL sizes would get more value investing in integration solutions rather than RPA. Integrating disparate systems is a problem that all companies face, & I believe it’s a problem of greater importance than automating repetitive tasks.I have also had several people ask me about “Industry 4.0” or “Supply Chain 4.0” or “Digitization” of the Supply Chainhttps://lnkd.in/eZfHNqy

#artofprocurement: Buyer’s Attitude for Gratitude The day before yesterday, I was undertaking a session on "Efficient processes in Procurement" for Power Mech Projects, Hyderabad and during my discourse, I realized how blessed and empowered we all procurement people are.We understand a business by taking it apart and putting it back together again from the bottom up and the top down. We enjoy the bounty of unbelievable network of suppliers and service partners that are required to make a chain of shops run, build a ship from scratch, get a new vaccine through trial and to markets, or help design the best new gadgets for sale.We all need to imbibe the attitude of gratitude that make us operate from a place of abundance and courage instead of a cavern of scarcity and fear. Gratitude unlocks the fullness of life. It turns what we have into enough, and more. It turns denial into acceptance, chaos into order, and confusion to clarity. This is what we want to implement!Gratitude raises your happiness quotient and your mental and emotional health improves; we can take better, informed decisions, and maker lesser mistakes. Moving with gratitude helps you concentrate on what you have, you’ll always have more. If you concentrate on what you don’t have, you’ll never have enough; an old adage from our scriptures.10 years back, we were talking about procurement transformation (not a digital one). We talked about negotiation, supplier relationships, risk, and collaboration. And now, we’re still talking about the same. Now through the help of AI, machine learning, and RPA.Did we fail?Over the last decade, has procurement failed in the mission to change, grow, and evolve?Delved deep inside myself and I heard the voice “We haven’t failed!” We’ve simply refused to stop pushing. We’ve succeeded so often, and in so many ways, that it become a habit. Procurement is an iterative effort, driven by passionate individuals who give everything from within. Can you imagine what we would look like if we had ever declared our journey done? We’d still be analyzing line items in spreadsheets and manually processing orders; tactical activities would only be our jobs.Procurement faced a lot of challenges in 2020. We didn’t like everything we had to do to make it through the year in one piece, but we did it anyway. More importantly, we learned from it. And we showed the world that we can come out with shining colorsWe are so lucky to have our jobs as critical, fascinating, measurable, and expanding. So, take a minute today, and every day going forward, to be grateful that you are a procurement professional.????: Help me in my job search by tagging me to the job announcements. ????-???????????????????? | ???? ??????????’ experience | ?????????????????????? | with ???????????????????????? and ?????????????????????????? | at Tata Projects, L&T, Reliance Industries, DLF Cement, Mahindra

Deutsche Telekom AG is a German telecommunications company headquartered in Bonn and by revenue the largest telecommunications provider in Europe. For many years, Deutsche Telekom has featured among Fortune 500 companies with its latest ranking 86 in 2020. The business experienced swift and significant results over the last years and became one of the biggest RPA users in Europe as it scaled up RPA automation in different lines of business.By 2018, with seven different RPA platforms and seven different libraries to maintain, the business began to experience issues at scale. The complex nature of this automation setup meant that a single change in the main CRM system led to change requests on four different RPA platforms. Due to the nature of RPA technology, it could not be easily combined with different tasks – such as manual task – or RPA technologies from different vendors, Deutsche Telekom began to experience major problems as it looked to implement end-to-end processes.For more https://lnkd.in/gG7k4ha #automation #rpa #ai #digitaltransformation #europe #telecommunications #data #technology #rpabots

Creating value and impact beyond cost reduction / efficiency would be the role of New Age CFOWe all talk that the future work would be more on AI, Robotics, machine learning but we talk very less on what our future work would be like?Most of the finance departments are implementing these fancy tools to cut costs and work faster but if we work only with this narrow perspective then work of tomorrow will be same as work of todayThe big opportunity for finance is to go beyond this notion and explore new sources of value to support business in this rapidly changing business environment by identifying unforseen problems, value levers, hidden opportunities to create high impactData Analytics to support business is one the key role which finance can play. We at Capgemini India were very fast to establish this function early when the pandemic startedWe first compared the data with 2008 IT crisis to pacify business on what can wrong..Business was now confident on the levers they need to use with their stakeholders like employees, customers etcWe then supported Analytics on quality of human capital and used the pandemic to reskill, re evaluate contracts on key pointsIt was then time to support business with better controls through analytics around leave management, productivity etcWe used RPA and chatbots to close faster and improve employee experienceWhen we got in high growth phase, analytics with hidden opportunities around Revenue maximization-- one of the analytics was providing a very different way to look at per hour charge out rate for same grade / skill but with different years of experience..A solid platform of credibility, trust with emotional connect was established and we have now build a team on story tellers and Data miners to support business within financeThus cost saving and efficiency can have long lasting impact and value when finance leaders use it to fund investments in new ideas, new ways of working and establishing better relationships with business#lifeatcapgemini #financetransformation

TOP 10 ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE TRENDS YOU MUST KNOW IN 2021Top 10 Artificial Intelligence Trends you must know in 20211. Ethical AI - Currently the most popular Artificial Intelligence trend in 2021 for providing the inside look into its own systems to stakeholders.  2. Explainable AI - Explainable AI is a part of ethical AI that provides a complete explanation of how the Artificial Intelligence models and machine learning algorithms are working inside to generate the appropriate meaningful business insights and predict the future.  3. Predictive Analytics - Advancements in Artificial Intelligence and machine learning algorithms are providing more accurate predictions and insights to maintain better customer engagement and gain higher ROI from the global market. 4. Emotional AI - Emotional AI can understand consumer behavior through verbal as well as non-verbal signals. Hi-tech cameras and Chatbots can easily detect various types of human emotions by studying the reactions to certain contents, products and services.  5. AI with AR and VR - Augmented Reality and Virtual reality are already providing immersive experiences to consumers as well as industries all around the world. 6. AI in Robotics - These solutions make robots smarter and intelligent like never before. It is a powerful combination to enhance customer service, perform successful surgeries, dance, protect employees from harmful environments and many more activities by leveraging into RPA. 7. AI in Cybersecurity - Integration of Artificial Intelligence in cybersecurity has created more advanced and powerful defense against harmful cyberattacks like phishing, ransomware, virus and so on. AI can instantly detect any unusual activity in the existing systems and generate alerts as soon as possible.  8. AI in Computer Vision - Integration of Artificial Intelligence in Computer Vision has transformed existing computer systems into analyzing human posture and movements, tracking humans and vehicles for collecting data, analyzing videos, detecting different levels of diseases, as well as identifying objects for autonomous vehicles. 9. AI in IT - AI is revolutionizing the IT sector and boosting productivity efficiently by providing the security to protect data from potential threats and data breaches, helping programmers in writing better code, taking over the boring, tedious and repetitive back-end duties, identifying and predicting complex problems, assuring the quality of products and services and much more assistance without any human intervention. 10. AI in IoT - Implementation of Artificial Intelligence into IoT can help smart devices such as wearable devices, virtual assistance, refrigerators, etc. to analyze data and make smart decisions efficiently based on the collected data without any human intervention. #artificialintelligence #AI #AItrends #ethicalAI #explainableAI #predictiveanalytics #aiot

Robotic Process Automation (RPA) is a rapidly growing industry that, according to Forrester, is expected to reach $2.9 billion this year. Five years ago, it had just $200 million worth of a market share. One of the key buzzwords among enterprises today, RPA captures the imagination of organizations looking to transform into truly digital enterprises. Many business leaders have already seen what RPA can do and are looking to implement it in their teams, departments, and entire companies. The best way to effectively implement RPA in your organization is to know the RPA software lifecycle. In this article, we give you a holistic overview of all the different stages RPA software undergoes to help you implement it systematically. Next, we share some best practices for implementing RPA to ensure that your journey to Robotic Process Automation is smooth and successful.https://lnkd.in/ea-Zxwr#automation #rpa #digitaltransformation #software #business #roboticprocessautomation #robotics #bankingindustry #banking

???? ?????? ???????? ???? ???????????????????????????? ???? ?????? ???????????? ?????? ?????????? ???? ???????????????? ???????????????? ?????? ????????????????????I was asked about areas that I saw as great targets for RPA / AI / ML  the other day.For me Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) is an area that is almost a no-brainer.In the slides you can see the Gartner who's who for CLM.I'm assuming that we all are on board with the benefits of CLM, it isn't a new concept but I have seen many examples of challenges around the successful implementation.I believe the usage of RPA / AI / ML may be a game changer here.If you look at how each of these solutions is focussing their development, they are all utilising AI for some / all of the bottlenecks in the process.We can make the process more efficient, automating the contracting process, creation, approval etc.We can make the process more integrated, automatically measure usage against the specification or expectations of the contract clauses and propose changes based on risk and spend.We can anticipate renewals and position with the stakeholders and suppliers to anticipate intelligently.I revisited a great article by Amenallah Reghimi of JAGGAER which also links to the Gartner magic quadrant by Patrick Connaughton, Kaitlynn Sommers, Marko Sillanpaa & Jim Murphy  both of which are well worth a read (links in comments).???????? ?????????? ???????????????? ???? ?????? / ???? / ???? ???????? ?????? ???????? ???? ???????#procurement #supplychain #innovation

URGENT HIRING !!!Senior Cloud Infrastructure ArchitectSign-On Bonus + Relocation AvailableThe Challenge:Everyone is trying to “harness the power of the cloud,” but not everyone knows how. As a cloud architect, you know how to build a cloud-based technical architecture that meets customer needs and takes advantage of cloud capabilities. What if you could use your cloud architecture skills to improve a digital enterprise transformation? We need you to help us develop cloud-based solutions to some of the Navy’s toughest challenges. As a Cloud Architect on our team, you’ll design a secure, cloud-based infrastructure to support mission-critical operations. You’ll recommend tools and capabilities based on your research of the current environment and knowledge of various on-premise, cloud-based, and hybrid resources. You’ll lead your team as they help the customer overcome their most difficult challenges in the cloud. Your technical expertise will be vital as you work with Navy transformation teams to ensure standards are met throughout the cloud migration process. This is an opportunity to use the latest cloud technologies as you look for ways to improve your customer’s environment using current cloud capabilities. You’ll be able to sharpen your skills in cloud infrastructure while developing critical systems for the Navy. As a technical leader, you’ll identify new opportunities to build cloud-based solutions to help your customers meet their evolving needs. Join our team as we transform the Navy with cloud technology.  Empower change with us.You Have:-7+ years of experience as a cloud infrastructure architect delivering client-focused solutions-4+ years of experience with architecting cloud infrastructures required to support systems being transformed from legacy architectures, including mainframe, .NET, or Java-Experience with preparing and briefing details of technical analysis-Active Secret clearance-BA or BS degreeNice If You Have:-Experience with mobile infrastructure solutions for a government client-Experience with documenting analysis in Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint-Knowledge of AWS technologies, tools, and service offerings-Knowledge of the Department of the Navy's organization structure and ranks-Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills-Possession of excellent client-facing and consulting skills-MA or MS degreeClearance:  Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified informationBuild Your Career:A challenging and dynamic work environment isn’t all we have to offer. When you join, you’ll have access to:Experts in virtually every fieldA culture that focuses on supporting our employeesOpportunities that provide stability while offering variety Kindly share your resume at career@kalongens.com #cloud #hiring #technology #experience #opportunity

Senior Solutions Architect – Strategic Solutions Arlington, VirginiaSign-on and Relocation Allowance AvailableThe Challenge:At a certain point, experience based system design can start to look like clairvoyance. When you’ve developed so many systems that you can not only orchestrate the best solution for any technology based challenge, but you can also anticipate and pre-empt future issues, you’re a solutions architect. As a solutions architect on our team, you'll translate your customer’s IT needs and future goals into a plan by crafting solution architectures, architecture products, and strategic recommendations to the client. Through your leadership, we’ll help transform the way DoD uses technology including cloud migration, integrating advanced technology, and modernizing legacy systems.  Empower change with us.You Have:6+ years of experience as a web or cloud architect designing client solutions4+ years of experience with designing architectures using APIs, basic web/cloud security, and data repositoriesExperience with preparing and briefing details of technical analysisActive Secret clearanceBA or BS degreeNice If You Have:Experience with mobile solutions or apps for a government clientExperience with documenting analysis in Microsoft Office products, including Word, Excel, and PowerPointKnowledge of general network technologies and principlesKnowledge of the Department of the Navy's organization structure and ranksKnowledge of DoD Architecture Framework (DoDAF)Possession of excellent oral and written communication skillsPossession of excellent client-facing and consulting skillsMA or MS degreeClearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Secret clearance is required.Build Your Career:A challenging and dynamic work environment isn’t all we have to offer. When you join, you’ll have access to:experts in virtually every fielda culture that focuses on supporting our employeesopportunities that provide stability while offering variety You’ll also be exposed to a wealth of training resources through our Digital University, an online learning portal featuring more than 5000 functional and technical courses, certifications, and books. Build your technical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications that directly impact your role? You may be able to take advantage of our tuition assistance, onsite boot camps, certification training, academic programs, vendor relationships, and a network of professionals who can give you helpful tips. We’ll help you develop the career you want as you chart your own course for success.Interested candidates kindly mail their resume at keshav@kalongens.com / contact - +1(559)5542554#HIRING #Kalongens #Recruit

Resource Solutions’ partnership with InfinityGlobal.IO on our Accelerate programme is providing exciting opportunities for experienced and talented people like Olakunle Ajose. Olakunle has more than ten years’ experience as a Business Analyst in areas including ERP, CRM, digital transformation, regulatory compliance, process improvement, product development and change management. He has also been a consultant Business Analyst and Project Manager for clients across various industries, including telecoms, financial services, healthcare, commerce and real estate.As well as vast experience of methodologies such as Agile, PRINCE2, waterfall and Lean Six Sigma, he is also an expert user of RACI Matrix, MS Project, Visio BPMN, JIRA Kanban and SharePoint. And now, the eight-week intensive training provided through our Accelerate programme means he can add accredited Business Analyst credentials to his CV. Every one of our Accelerate graduates has impressed me, and I’m really looking forward to seeing where the combination of their new skills and experience will take them next. #accelerate #socialmobility #businessanalyst

Position   :  UI/UX DesignerYears EXP : 6 - 10+Job type :Full time Location  : Dubai (Only local to Dubai )Client -MNC Notice Period: Immediate -20Days only JD :Job Objective: User Experience (UX) designing team has end-to-end responsibility for UX analysis and UX design for (digital) processes, interfaces, and customer communications from a customer/user perspective, while also helping improve (digital) processes. The purpose of these UX activities is to increase customer satisfaction, user-friendliness and accessibility of our(digital) services in order to create an optimum, authentic and consistent Omni channel user experience. The team works based on quantitative and qualitative data and draws on validated customer insights. In UX we make a distinction between Service Design, Interaction Design, Visual Design or Usability Design.  Key Result Areas:·       Has skill and knowledge on the different wireframing and prototyping software tools (Abstract, Figma, Axure, Invision or equivalent) and in design software tools (Sketch, Photoshop or equivalent). ·       Ensure they follow the organizations standard design framework and libraries·       Contributes, based on his/her design expertise and experience to all sprint events (planning, refinements, retrospectives, demos). ·       Consults the Head of Transformation Office about the development and design needs for a Squad and Chapter. ·       Explores market trends and market evolutions in his domain. ·       Looks into all sorts of possibilities and explore different options for concept and design. After thorough exploration, which might include discussion groups with customers or users (i.e. voice of the customer), the designer defines the high level user requirements and an exploratory version or prototype of the design. ·       Creates first and final version(s) of the design to be. ·       In collaboration the Customer Journey Expert combines and weighs user requirements with (high level) functional, product and commercial requirements. The design and prototype is further detailed and adapted through iterations while the designer acquires and incorporates detailed insights from user tests and usage data. ·       Gathers feedback on every version of the design and sets up alignment with the different internal stakeholders (both business and IT) ·       Validates the design by discussion groups with end users/clients, AB testing by groups of customers of different versions of the design, the prototype or the first version of the product. ·       Contributes to the implementation of the UX strategy of Digital Studio ·       Translates UX strategy in terms of the Chapter.

Position   :  UI/UX DesignerYears EXP : 6 - 10+Job type :Full time Location  : Dubai (Only local to Dubai )Client -MNC Notice Period: Immediate -20Days only JD :Job Objective: User Experience (UX) designing team has end-to-end responsibility for UX analysis and UX design for (digital) processes, interfaces, and customer communications from a customer/user perspective, while also helping improve (digital) processes. The purpose of these UX activities is to increase customer satisfaction, user-friendliness and accessibility of our(digital) services in order to create an optimum, authentic and consistent Omni channel user experience. The team works based on quantitative and qualitative data and draws on validated customer insights. In UX we make a distinction between Service Design, Interaction Design, Visual Design or Usability Design.  Key Result Areas:·       Has skill and knowledge on the different wireframing and prototyping software tools (Abstract, Figma, Axure, Invision or equivalent) and in design software tools (Sketch, Photoshop or equivalent). ·       Ensure they follow the organizations standard design framework and libraries·       Contributes, based on his/her design expertise and experience to all sprint events (planning, refinements, retrospectives, demos). ·       Consults the Head of Transformation Office about the development and design needs for a Squad and Chapter. ·       Explores market trends and market evolutions in his domain. ·       Looks into all sorts of possibilities and explore different options for concept and design. After thorough exploration, which might include discussion groups with customers or users (i.e. voice of the customer), the designer defines the high level user requirements and an exploratory version or prototype of the design. ·       Creates first and final version(s) of the design to be. ·       In collaboration the Customer Journey Expert combines and weighs user requirements with (high level) functional, product and commercial requirements. The design and prototype is further detailed and adapted through iterations while the designer acquires and incorporates detailed insights from user tests and usage data. ·       Gathers feedback on every version of the design and sets up alignment with the different internal stakeholders (both business and IT) ·       Validates the design by discussion groups with end users/clients, AB testing by groups of customers of different versions of the design, the prototype or the first version of the product. ·       Contributes to the implementation of the UX strategy of Digital Studio ·       Translates UX strategy in terms of the Chapter.  Interested ppl send updated resume to n.karthik@keirinsofttech.com or call me +919849677900

Men’s grooming has come a long way from basic ‘manscaping’. Thanks to advances in hair science, more and more men and women are taking control of their hair loss with hair loss solutions such as medications, as well as hair transplantation.The procedure is quick (walk in and out after a few hours), minimally invasive and produces the hairline you used to have or always dreamed of. As we place our best face forward for online meetings and reunions, it’s important to feel confident about how to present ourselves. Here’s why now might be the best time to finally take action on your hairline.Distance doesn’t mean inconvenient- book a virtual hair loss consultation now and speak to a doctor about your hair loss problems.1. Work and recover from homePreviously, getting a hair transplant meant a 3-5 days off work and a series of explanations to colleagues about your absence. Older styles of hair transplantation (FUE or FUT) can be invasive and painful. However, the latest advancement in hair restoration is the Direct Hair Implantation (DHI) technique, which allows for faster recovery. Most patients can return to computer-based work as early as the next day. Some even answer urgent emails during the procedure itself!The recovery phase is easy and comfortable, 3 days of mild swelling then a progressive return to exercise and outdoor activities. At one week post-op, patients can resume light exercise and by two weeks post op, the recovery is complete, and patients can return to full exercise, including contact sports, swimming and haircuts.2. Luxury you can wear 365 days of the yearGalas, events and travel are on a temporary pause. These days, our hair is our best expression of how we feel, the fashion, and our personality. The shift in consumer spending to self-care has seen more and more men and women looking to finally treat our skin, hair and bodies with mini-luxuries where we can. With the lower halves of our faces (and bodies) concealed for the foreseeable future, adding more on top has never been a better investment.As our hair hero Jun Sunga put it, ‘divide the investment by the number of years you expect to enjoy it, and the decision is easy’.@robsoncosta – international model, DHI Philippines / @Robbycarmona- style icon, DHI Philippines3. Virtual hair loss consultations, wherever you areClinique de Paris has made the digital transformation to adjust and adapt quickly and safely. We set up virtual consultations to allow patients to discuss their hair loss concerns with trained consultants and doctors. This means more privacy, more answers, and less exposure. Patients just send photos of their problem areas (to info@dhi-philippines.com), and the specialist will immediately diagnose your condition and offer a tailored treatment plan. This helps to find truth amongst the fake news, so you save money, time and your hair.Separating false news and expert advice is important- speak to a professional to save time, money and your hair.

When I tell people I work in the Tech Industry, they assume I am a programmer, a data analyst or someone Technical who contribute to the creation of a product. Not quite, but working in the Commercial department, I contribute to the sale of this product or service, so it's also very exciting!Since I joined the Tech Industry, I worked for companies selling complex products, CloudSense, a CPQ solution, Decibel a digital experience platform and now at VRP Consulting, I must learn about our own products and services but also Salesforce's (thank you Trailhead).As an SDR or even now as an Alliances Manager, I was never asked to do a deep dive in the product but I was always curious and wanted to have a better understanding of the features and capabilities. Not only it would help me get better at my job but it also felt empowering to increase my knowledge.When we started the onboarding of our new partner Docomotion and the training of our consultants to become champions, I realised quickly that if we wanted the sandbox to be configurated properly to enable my team to complete the exercises, I would have to step up and complete the training too so I could get the right features added and understand the pain points of my colleagues.I am so proud that even without a technical background, I managed to complete the tasks given and become a Docomotion Certified Expert! This is the first real evidence that I am able to add more strings to my bow and expand my skills in the Tech Industry.Thank you David Alon and the Docomotion team for the praise when completing the exercise and I am looking forward to obtaining my Champion certificate. :) Do you think Sales people should allocate more time into the learning of the complex capabilities of their products? Or is it something to leave to specialists? #techindustry #learningtechnologies #trailblazer #training

Market leader is seeking a business consultant with Commercial Banking lending or credit underwriting experience looking for a ground-floor opportunity to be the next great consulting firm dedicated to deploying FinTech solutions into traditional banking environments.
