For those who aren't yet aware, last year I enrolled in the UT Austin Boot Camp for full stack web development. I'm very excited to announce that I recently completed the program and am now ready to start applying for web developer positions!! ??Please take a look at my portfolio website, which I created from scratch using many of the skills and tools that I learned in the boot camp.?? Portfolio:  https://lnkd.in/et3zfigI've been working in health care as a registered dietitian for nearly five years now. While I have been successful in this career and am very proud of everything I've accomplished so far, I strongly believe my overall skills are much better suited for the tech field.One of the things that initially attracted me to health care was the desire to help others solve their (??nutrition-related) problems. However, it has become increasingly clear to me over the years that I thrive most when I'm helping people solve problems through the use of ??technology. For anyone who knows me well or has worked with me in some capacity, this will likely not come as a surprise. After all, I always seem to return to my love for computer technology when it comes to solving a variety of problems. This has been true throughout my career as a dietitian and throughout much of my life in general! For these reasons, I'm very excited to finally take this major step forward in my professional journey. Pursuing a career change after investing so much into my current career was a difficult decision for me. However, I'm a firm believer that it's never too late to pursue your passion.With all that being said, if you feel you're able to speak to my work ethic and/or skills, I'm kindly asking if you can help me with any of the following:? Post a recommendation to my LinkedIn Profile (I'll happily return the favor)? Add your endorsement to any professional skills that you feel is relevant (also on my LinkedIn profile)? Let me know about any potential job opportunities that you hear about, or pass along my info if you know someone hiring for a web developer position. I'm currently looking for positions throughout most of Texas and Florida, though a remote job would be ideal.? Let me help you with a small web project. I'm happy to volunteer my time to help in exchange for a recommendation/testimonial! ??? Like/share this post to help me get the word out. ??Thank you all in advance for any help you can provide. Over the years, many of you have offered to provide me with a professional recommendation when needed, and I greatly appreciate that as well.If you're a hiring manager interested in my work, then I would love to talk to you. Please feel free to reach out to me either here or via email.? I am not always an advocate of the most current #tech.  #Reactjs is currently powering nearly nine million websites worldwide.  WIth an estimated 200 million active websites, that means reactjs is running nearly 5% of the active internet at the time of this post (Y'all can fillet me if my math or stats are wrong).  Many of the projects we work on as a #freelancedeveloper do not require heavy libraries like reactjs.  Also, many of them use aging but mature technology stacks (hello php developers).  This being said, I have to admit I have been absolutely loving developing websites with #gatsbyjs and #graphql.  I feel that it is a front end framework that I will stick with for a while because it is both fast and has an awesome plugin ecosystem baked in.  I am really appreciating the modularity of react and the ability to create rich, dynamic "static" websites using the graphql queries.  if you are a #webdeveloper, I highly recommend giving gatsbyjs a try for smaller projects.  Heck, it can even do more complex projects like e-commerce if you want.  I am looking forward to sharing this website and its awesome performance gains soon,  #fullstackwebdeveloper #jamstack #javascriptdeveloper #scss #reactdeveloper #reactjsdevelopment #webdevelopers #nodejsdeveloper

We're currently looking for a PHP Developer to join our Tech Team https://bit.ly/3kr6r07 If you're wondering what the job looks like, let us introduce you to Silvia Carreño, our Product Owner: ? What are the dynamics and collaboration like between Tech and Product?We work as a very agile team, following the Scrum methodology with all its tools, and our daily meeting is one of my favorites. With remote work, it’s really useful to connect in meetings altogether, share comments, information… These daily catch-ups are very important in order to be aligned and remove impediments as fast as possible to keep a continuous outcome delivery flow. As a Product Owner, I like to focus on pains and work with the team to find the best solutions to issues that can come up when we work together in cross-functional teams. We are also bringing in OKRs in our Sprint Retrospective every 2 weeks to share the progress and see how new features built by the Devteam have an impact on corporate objectives.? What are the upcoming projects and priorities? We are in the middle of a very challenging year for Dev and Product at Degusta Box. We just released a full Backend refactoring and now our focus is on the User Profile to improve Customer Retention. We have challenging projects such as building a new frontend fed by a new API under construction; implement a new server architecture and apply technology changes to improve the capabilities; finishing unit tests for the Backend and start the functional for frontend/API; and optimize processes as recurrent payments, one of the most important automation for a subscription business. We aim to deliver new features with a customer-centric approach and retain our users with the best surprises inside the monthly box but also with the most useful utilities to give them autonomy and ease in how they buy new products and manage their subscriptions with Degusta Box.? Why would you recommend Degusta Box as a place to work? One of the things I like the most about working at Degusta Box is the collaborative environment, and how the company encourages us to have ownership and share our point of view. It’s a very important value for me, in order to not limit initiatives and ideas that can come from other departments and stakeholders, helping to pursue our mission as a company. Also, good vibes between departments and most of all with the Dev team is what keeps me loving my job.To apply: https://bit.ly/3kr6r07#degustabox #jobsinbarcelona #devjobs #techjobs #recruitingnow #developer

"Never stay in a place where no one sees your value"A story of a father and her son. I recommend everyone to read it.A father said to his son "You have graduated with honors, here is a car I bought many years ago. It is pretty old now. But before I give it to you, take it to the used car lot downtown and tell them I want to sell it and see how much they offer you for it."The son went to the used car lot, returned to her father and said, "They offered me Rs.70,000 because the said it looks pretty worn out."The father said, now "Take it to the pawn shop."The son went to the pawn shop, returned to her father and said," The pawn shop offered only Rs.8000 because it is an old car."The father asked his son to go to a car club now & show them the car.The son then took the car to the club, returned and told her father, " Some people in the club offered 10 Lakhs for it because it's a Toyota Fortuner, it's an iconic car and sought by many collectors".Now the father said this to his son, "The right place values you the right way," If you are not valued, do not be angry, it means you are in the wrong place. Those who know your value are those who appreciate you....Never stay in a place where no one sees your value.#people #success #motivation #life #sales ...#coding #codinglife #coder #python #programming #javascript #css #developer #php #developers #android #webdevelopment #stackoverflow #script #errors #webdeveloper #java #machinelearnig #project #microsoft #vscode

Requirement Details: Technology Lead(IT Team Lead)Location : Mumbai/WFHExperience : 4 - 7 YearsFunction : Technology - IT & SystemsJob Summary :We are looking for experienced Techies to lead a team. Should have a minimum of 4+ years of a lead role (team management) with minimum of 3+ years in e-commerce/ Shopify, CMS, WordPress, and Magento development.Responsibilities and Duties:?     The incumbent has to manage the company's e-commerce portal along with the specified      responsibilities as mentioned below.?     Act as Shopify, CMS, WordPress and Magento expert, specializing in all facets of the ecommerce platform development for our clients.?     Keep up to date with the business domain and work closely with business stakeholders.?     Ensure our solutions address the business needs of the business sponsors / leaders.?     Adhere to business requirements and provide on time deliveries.?     Plan and execute various aspects of projects not only bound to but beyond Shopify boundaries.?     Should have basic understanding of CMS platforms such as Shopify, Wordpress & Magento. ?     Has worked on multiple Shopify,CMS,WordPress, and Magento projects from mid to high level of complexity especially on Ecommerce platform.?     Generate custom - tailored Shopify/wordpress/magento theme and altering pre - existing template.?     Ensuring high-performance and availability, and managing all technical aspects of the CMS. ?       Experts in WordPress Development who can generally create both custom plugins and modules as well as develop themes – all built upon their knowledge of the PHP framework. ?     Creation of custom post types, plugins/ widgets, Theme/ Template integration.?       Develop custom WP plugins, modules, and themes.?     Work on Magento integration with external systems, viz CMS/CRM/ERP/Payment/Shipping etc.?     Good understanding of database structure of Magento 1.9 & 2.?     Should have excellent knowledge of Servers/AWS/VPS Server setting up & maintenance. ?     Should have hands on experience on working with YII, Laravel, Codeigniter. Qualifications and Skills:?       Ability to manage projects independently.?       Good communication skills.?       Strong understanding of WordPress, Shopify, CMS and Magento back-end development.Benefits:?       A fresh and inspiring atmosphere with a lot of passionate people.?       Solid salary and a responsible position in our company.?       The fantastic workspace you will love.?       Professional development experience.?       Excellent opportunity to make something great. network. ?       Job Type: Full-time#lead #teamlead #Shopify #WordPress #CMS #Magento

Hi,Looking for RAN Deployment Engineer for one of my direct client , remote position with below skillPlease share resume at salwan.singh@orchestratec.com# Responsible for direct field support for Open-RAN on virtualized infrastructure. This role is responsible for deployment, integration and maintenance manage integrations, with any third-party products in field deployments and supporting live networks. Key Responsibilities *    Installs, commissions and integrates RAN solution including DU, CU, CMS (both NFV and Containerized based solutions) *    Prepare essential documentation, including deployment layout and integration details (CIQ) *    Prepare configuration files for Radio sites / carriers using customer provided information in CIQ *    Ensures end-to-end connectivity for the RAN solution with packet core. This includes Synchronization (PTP) and other OpenRAN interfaces (Control, User and & Management M-Plane) *    Perform deployment for RAN network functions on Kubernetes infrastructure *    Provide root cause analysis, workarounds and bug fixes for issues during integration phase. *    Identify problems and choose appropriate architectural solutions; design, specify, implement, and test solutions *    Provides technical support for Mavenir RAN solution at customer location *    Provides knowledge transfer to customer personnel through On the Job training *    Identifies any issues that need Mavenir fixes or solutions

Both Wix and WordPress are great choices for website design. They both provide built-in features, templates, and add-ons that can be of use to many organizations. Users without technological experience are able to use these website building platforms without learning how to code. When comparing the two, it is a matter of which features you would like which we have described in our WordPress vs. Wix blog.Wix has limits to how much you can customize the appearance and functionality to the website. You're unable to add forms (CTA's) or featured images to blog posts on Wix. You're unable to switch your website template so if you decide to rebrand it may be tricky! And you can’t access or change the HTML of your site.Advanced users or businesses looking to get the extra edge features that WordPress offers may want to use WordPress for its content management system (CMS) features. Below, we take a look how to convert your Wix website into WordPress. Read More: https://bit.ly/3vV7xmQ

Partly because of language barriers in Korea, Google's search engine was not optimized for solving the needs of Koreans back in the mid-2000s. That's when Korean search engines Naver and Daum(owned by Kakao) were successful at customizing content for Koreans before the advent of YouTube. Naver excelled with three signature products. The first one was Naver blog, the second one was Naver knowledge In(similar to Quora), and Naver cafe(which provides CMS and membership management functions). It has succeeded in curating News and Entertainment content in a uniform manner with rankings and comments. I believe Koreans really loved these features because these were ways to look into the minds of others within a similar boundary of culture. Naver has perfectly provided such functions which Google did not seem to provide. Also unlike Google's search engine policy, Naver's ranking system gives fewer points for old posts. That means you could get instantly searched for certain keywords in Naver. That was massive compensation within the context of the mid-2000s. Of course, one could argue that the authority of the domain(blog.naver.com) was guaranteed, so such result ranking is obvious. The problem was that Naver refused to be searched by the Google search bot.

looking out for an web designer minimum experience of four to five years specialised in web designing and any degree with a good package offered. Web Designer duties and responsibilities of the jobRequiring both technical and creative skills, a Web Designer job description typically includes some of these tasks and duties:Designing engaging and responsive landing pagesIntegrating client CMS programs and data feeds into websitesOptimising sites for maximum speed and scalabilityEmploying industry and design best practice through website build processConducting website testingLiaising with back-end developers to ensure web and app logic is properly integratedEnsuring website function and stability across devices i.e. desktop, mobile, tabletWorking with marketing and research teams to incorporate brand elements and relevant market research findings into websiteProviding internal support and external customer service throughout the build and launch process of the websiteWeb Designer job qualifications and requirementsCertificates, diplomas and degrees can all be cited as ‘preferred’ in a Web Designer job description, and are not essential. It is common for web design candidates to be self-taught, or have completed on-the-job training to develop key skills and gain experience with specialised applications. If a formal qualification is requested, the relevant areas of study are:Web DesignDigital MediaInformation TechnologyScience or Computer ScienceGraphic DesignIt is however critical to list the software and programs that candidates need to be proficient in. Some of these are listed below. Requesting a minimum of three years’ experience is also recommended.HTMLCSSjQueryJavaScriptAdobe Suite – Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesignAPI web integrationExperience in User Experience (UX) and User Interface (UI)

Move your brick and mortar business to online e-commerceOnline e-commerce platforms are essential if there is a likelihood to run an online e-commerce business. Whether you are a B2C or B2B traditional business, the right e-commerce platform will enable you to execute complex business functions online.Not only can you move the process of interaction with your prospects faster, but also you will minimise the human intervention of your staff and eliminate human mistakes.However, selecting an online channel is not as easy as it seems – it strongly depends on the items you are going to sell and the target audience. That’s why the best e-commerce system is the one that meets your business needs and requirements.Take a closer look at the e-commerce solutions available:? Fully-functional e-commerce sites: mostly this type provides companies with the ability to utilize ready-to-use ecommerce solutions such as Shopify, Magento, WooCommerce, etc. that bring significant benefits. Not only are a variety of these CMS solutions open-source and free, but they also offer unlimited customisations for your e-commerce business.However, if ready-to-use CMSs lack the required features and functionality for the future solution, you can build your own custom CMS from scratch to meet your unique needs and requirements.?? You can integrate third-party solutions such as analytics, email marketing, workflow automation features, or payment gateway options. Whether you need to track the progress of your online e-commerce in real time, streamline the order process or make data-driven business decisions, integration capabilities provide real advantages.?? You can get customers’ insights by incorporating analytics to retrieve actionable customer data (names, e-mails) and analyze their preferences, likes and dislikes, to offer products based on their personalized needs.?? Only by delivering a more sophisticated experience to the visitors of your e-store can you get higher conversion rates.? Online marketplaces: these types of e-commerce stores don’t include purchasing a license – it’s quite easy to set up and maintain. All you need is to register and upload your products. However, online marketplaces have the pricing structure that means they can charge a commission on every item listed or sold while your profits or payments are usually delayed.? Social commerce networks: not only can you promote your traditional physically located business with social media platforms, but also they allow you to sell some products. What’s more, you can simply sync or embed your existing online e-commerce business into a social commerce site for selling. The disadvantage of social commerce networks is that you need additional resources to manage your online presence because they provide very limited tools for customisation.However, it’s worth noting that if you have enough time and financial resources, there’s no rule against selling on multiple e-commerce channels.

I put together a guide comparing and contrasting the HubSpot CMS and WordPress CMS. When making the decision for electrIQ marketing about which CMS platform to go with, some of the key factors were:Ease of UseFlexible DevelopmentContent Creation that ScalesSupportAdvanced Website Testing (A/B and multivariate)Deep Integration with our CRMIn my decision-making process, I tried to take into account the various team members that would be using our CMS, from our development team all the way down to our content marketing team.TLDR: The biggest differentiator between HubSpot and WordPress is the ability to seamlessly integrate your CRM into your website, making things such as “dynamic” or “smart” content (where a button, form, module, or entire webpage changes dynamically based on the data you have on a contact in your CRM) possible. Even better, if a contact isn’t in your CRM yet, you can still utilize smart content with rules based on IP location, referral source, and more.#hubspot #hubspotcms #wordpress #cms #contentmarketing
